- Custom AI provider support
- History loading from Walrus
- Proof verification system

99â†’ When you use ChatGPT, Claude, or other AI services, your conversations are stored on their servers. 100â†’ You don't know who can access your data, how long it's kept, or if it's used for training. 101â†’

102â†’
103â†’
104â†’ 105â†’
106â†’
107â†’ 108â†’
109â†’
110â†’

The MindVault Solution

111â†’

112â†’ With MindVault, your conversations are encrypted before they leave your browser. 113â†’ The encrypted data is stored on decentralized infrastructure (Walrus), and access control 114â†’ is managed through Sui blockchain. You can delete, export, or migrate your data anytime. 115â†’

116â†’
    117â†’

    • 125â†’
  • 126â†’ 127â†’ Encryption key derived from your wallet signature 128â†’

  • 130â†’ 131â†’ You control who can access and when to revoke 132â†’

An Honest Disclosure

144â†’

185â†’

Client-side encryption, decentralized storage, and blockchain-based access control on Sui. 6â†’ 7â†’[![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) 8â†’ 9â†’[English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) 10â†’ 11â†’--- 12â†’ 13â†’ 14â†’ 15â†’## Author's Philosophy 16â†’ 17â†’### Why MindVault? 18â†’ 19â†’When we use ChatGPT, Claude, or other AI services, there's an uncomfortable reality: 20â†’- Your conversation history is stored on the provider's servers 21â†’- You don't know who can access your data, or if it's used for training 22â†’- You can't truly delete or migrate your data 23â†’ 24â†’MindVault was built to answer one question: **Who should own AI conversation data?** 25â†’ 26â†’Our answer: **The user.** 27â†’ 28â†’### An Honest Disclosure 29â†’ 30â†’We believe in transparency. Here's exactly what MindVault can and cannot do: 31â†’ 32â†’**What We Can Do:** 33â†’- Encrypt your conversations before storage - the platform never sees plaintext 34â†’- Store data on decentralized infrastructure you control (Walrus) 35â†’- Manage access permissions on-chain with instant revocation (Sui) 36â†’- Process AI requests statelessly - no server-side data retention 37â†’- Let you export, delete, or migrate your data freely 38â†’ 39â†’**What We Cannot Do (Yet):** 40â†’- Hide your messages from the AI provider during inference - they need to see plaintext to process it 41â†’- This is a fundamental limitation of current LLM technology, not something we can bypass 42â†’ 43â†’### Future Direction 44â†’ 45â†’We're researching next-generation privacy AI technologies: 46â†’- **TEE (Trusted Execution Environment)**: Run AI inference in hardware-secured enclaves where even operators can't see your data 47â†’- **Local Models**: Support running open-source models locally so your data never leaves your device 48â†’ 49â†’MindVault aims to become **privacy AI infrastructure**, progressively achieving true end-to-end privacy as technology evolves. 50â†’ 51â†’--- 52â†’ 53â†’## User Story 54â†’ 55â†’### The Problem 56â†’ 57â†’Alex is a freelancer who uses AI assistants to: 58â†’- Organize client requirements 59â†’- Draft contracts and emails 60â†’- Brainstorm product ideas 61â†’ 62â†’But Alex has a concern: these conversations contain client-sensitive information, business ideas, and even private thoughts. Alex doesn't know how long the data is stored, if it's used for training, or who might access it. 63â†’ 64â†’### The MindVault Solution 65â†’ 66â†’With MindVault: 67â†’ 68â†’1. **Connect Wallet**: Alex logs in with a Sui wallet - no registration needed 69â†’2. **Encrypted Storage**: Every message is encrypted in the browser before being stored 70â†’3. **Keys in Your Hands**: The encryption key is derived from Alex's wallet signature - only Alex can decrypt 71â†’4. **Full Control**: Alex can delete any conversation instantly, without "requesting" deletion 72â†’5. **Fully Portable**: If a better service comes along, Alex can export all data and take it 73â†’ 74â†’Alex can finally discuss sensitive topics with AI confidently - not because the AI can't see it (it still does during inference), but because the data is **completely under Alex's control** and won't persist on some unknown server forever. 75â†’ 76â†’--- 77â†’ 78â†’## Current Features 79â†’ 80â†’| Feature | Status | Description | 81â†’|---------|--------|-------------| 82â†’| Wallet Connection | Live | Sui Wallet, Suiet, and more | 83â†’| Client-Side Encryption | Live | AES-256-GCM, key derived from wallet signature | 84â†’| Decentralized Storage | Live | Walrus testnet integration | 85â†’| On-Chain Access Control | Live | Sui smart contract for permissions | 86â†’| Instant Revocation | Live | User can unilaterally revoke any authorization | 87â†’| Custom AI Providers | Live | Bring your own API key (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, etc.) | 88â†’| Stateless Processing | Live | API layer never persists any data | 89â†’| Local Models | Planned | WebLLM / Ollama support | 90â†’| TEE Inference | Research | Hardware-secured AI processing | 91â†’ 92â†’--- 93â†’ 94â†’## Architecture 95â†’ 96â†’### Dual-Layer Privacy Model 97â†’ 98â†’``` 99â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” 100â†’â”‚ User Browser (Trust Zone) â”‚ Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

Excellent! Now I have a comprehensive understanding of the codebase. Let me create a detailed report:

## MindVault-Sui Codebase Exploration Report

I've completed a thorough exploration of the MindVault-Sui project. Here's a comprehensive breakdown of the current implementation:

### 1. **Overall Project Structure**

```
/Users/zayn/ALL_Projects/é»‘å®¢æ¾/SuiVibe/
â”œâ”€â”€ contracts/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ data_vault/
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ sources/
â”‚           â””â”€â”€ data_vault.move          # Sui smart contract
â”œâ”€â”€ frontend/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ app/
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ page.tsx                 # Landing page
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ chat/page.tsx            # Chat interface
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ dashboard/page.tsx       # Dashboard
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ settings/page.tsx        # Settings & AI provider config
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ api/chat/route.ts        # AI chat API endpoint
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ layout.tsx               # Root layout
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ components/
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ChatInterface.tsx        # Main chat component
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Header.tsx               # Navigation header
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Providers.tsx            # Sui/React providers
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hooks/
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ useVault.ts              # Vault management hook
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ useEncryption.ts         # Encryption hook
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ lib/
â”‚   â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ sui.ts                   # Sui client & transactions
â”‚   â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ walrus.ts                # Walrus storage integration
â”‚   â”‚       â””â”€â”€ encryption.ts            # AES-256-GCM encryption
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ package.json
â”œâ”€â”€ README.md
â””â”€â”€ AI_DISCLOSURE.md
```

---

### 2. **Frontend Pages & Components**

#### **Landing Page** (`/src/app/page.tsx`)
- Hero section with "Your Data, Your Rules" messaging
- Feature cards highlighting:
  - Client-side encryption (AES-256-GCM)
  - Decentralized storage (Walrus)
  - Stateless processing
- "Honest Disclosure" section explaining what MindVault can/cannot do
- Current features table showing live features and planned features
- Footer with GitHub and documentation links

#### **Chat Page** (`/src/app/chat/page.tsx`)
- Simple wrapper that renders `ChatInterface` component

#### **Dashboard** (`/src/app/dashboard/page.tsx`)
- Status cards showing:
  - Wallet connection status
  - Encryption initialization status
  - Data vault status
- Vault details display (ID, creation date, blob count)
- Quick action links to Chat and Settings
- List of all user vaults

#### **Settings Page** (`/src/app/settings/page.tsx`)
- **AI Provider Configuration Section:**
  - Quick preset buttons for OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama
  - Manual input fields for baseURL, API key, model
  - Test connection button
  - Save configuration button
  - Security notice about localStorage storage
  
- **Access Management Section:**
  - Grant access modal for authorizing providers
  - List of authorized providers with scope and expiration
  - Revoke access buttons
  - Info section explaining how access control works

#### **ChatInterface Component** (`/src/components/ChatInterface.tsx`)
- Provider status bar showing current AI provider
- Checkbox to enable/disable Walrus encryption
- Message display with timestamps and encryption indicators
- Input form with send button
- Auto-scroll to latest messages
- Handles:
  - Encryption of messages before Walrus upload
  - AI API calls with custom provider config
  - Storing encrypted messages on Walrus
  - Message history (last 10 messages sent to API)

---

### 3. **Smart Contract Implementation** (`/contracts/data_vault/sources/data_vault.move`)

**Core Objects:**
- `DataVault`: User's owned object containing:
  - `blob_count`: Number of stored blobs
  - `created_at`: Creation timestamp
  - Dynamic fields for authorizations and blob references

- `Authorization`: Stored in vault's dynamic field:
  - `provider`: Authorized party address
  - `scope`: 1=read, 2=read-write
  - `expires_at`: Expiration time (0=never)
  - `created_at`: Creation timestamp

- `BlobRef`: Stored in vault's dynamic field:
  - `blob_id`: Walrus blob ID
  - `blob_type`: 0=conversation, 1=file
  - `iv`: AES-GCM initialization vector
  - `created_at`: Creation timestamp

**Key Functions:**
- `create_vault()`: Creates a new DataVault owned by user
- `store_blob()`: Stores blob reference with IV
- `delete_blob()`: Removes blob reference
- `grant_access()`: Adds authorization to vault
- `revoke_access()`: Removes authorization from vault
- `is_authorized()`: Checks if provider is authorized (with expiration check)
- `get_authorization()`: Returns scope and expiration
- `get_blob_ref()`: Returns blob details
- `get_vault_info()`: Returns blob count and creation time
- `blob_exists()`: Checks if blob exists
- `auth_exists()`: Checks if authorization exists

**Key Design:**
- Uses Dynamic Fields for unlimited extensibility
- Authorization data stored IN the vault (user always owns it)
- User can revoke access unilaterally without provider cooperation
- Events emitted for all state changes

---

### 4. **API Routes** (`/src/app/api/chat/route.ts`)

**Endpoint:** `POST /api/chat`

**Request Body:**
```typescript
{
  message: string;
  provider: {
    baseURL: string;
    apiKey: string;
    model: string;
  };
  history?: ChatMessage[];
}

**Features:**

- Sends last 10 messages as conversation history
- Stateless processing - no data persistence

- DeepSeek (deepseek-chat, deepseek-coder)

---

### 5. **Hooks**

#### **useVault.ts** (`/src/hooks/useVault.ts`)
**State:**
- `vaults`: Array of user's vaults

- `error`: Error messages

**Functions:**
- `fetchVaults()`: Queries user's DataVault objects from Sui

- `storeBlob()`: Stores blob reference on-chain
- `grantAccess()`: Grants access to provider
- `revokeAccess()`: Revokes provider access
- `setCurrentVault()`: Switches active vault

**Key Behavior:**
- Auto-fetches vaults when account changes
- Sets first vault as current if none selected
- Refreshes vault details after operations

#### **useEncryption.ts** (`/src/hooks/useEncryption.ts`)
**State:**
- `isInitialized`: Whether encryption key is derived
- `isInitializing`: Initialization in progress
- `error`: Error messages

**Functions:**
- `initialize()`: Derives encryption key from wallet signature
- `encrypt()`: Encrypts plaintext to ciphertext + IV
- `decrypt()`: Decrypts ciphertext using IV
- `clear()`: Clears encryption key from memory

**Key Behavior:**
- Auto-initializes when wallet connects
- Uses wallet signature for deterministic key derivation
- Lazy initialization on first encrypt/decrypt if needed

---

### 6. **Library Files**

#### **encryption.ts** (`/src/lib/encryption.ts`)
**EncryptionService Class:**
- Uses Web Crypto API for AES-256-GCM
- Key derivation via HKDF from wallet signature
- Random IV generation for each encryption
- Singleton pattern for service instance

**Key Functions:**
- `deriveKeyFromWallet()`: HKDF-based key derivation
- `encrypt()`: Returns {ciphertext, iv}
- `decrypt()`: Takes ciphertext and IV
- `isInitialized()`: Checks if key is ready
- `clear()`: Clears key from memory

**Utilities:**
- `toHex()` / `fromHex()`: Uint8Array â†” hex string

#### **sui.ts** (`/src/lib/sui.ts`)

- `buildRevokeAccessTx()`: Revokes provider access
- `buildDeleteBlobTx()`: Deletes blob reference

**Query Functions:**
- `getUserVaults()`: Fetches all user vaults
- `getVaultDetails()`: Gets vault info including owner

#### **walrus.ts** (`/src/lib/walrus.ts`)
**Endpoints:**
- Aggregator: `https://aggregator.walrus-testnet.walrus.space`
- Publisher: `https://publisher.walrus-testnet.walrus.space`

**Functions:**
- `uploadToWalrus()`: Uploads encrypted data, returns blobId + endEpoch
- `downloadFromWalrus()`: Downloads blob by ID
- `blobExists()`: Checks if blob exists

**Key Features:**

---

### 7. **Current Features Status**

| Feature | Status | Implementation |
|---------|--------|-----------------|
| Wallet Connection | Live | Sui Wallet, Suiet via @mysten/dapp-kit |

| Decentralized Storage | Live | Walrus testnet integration |

| Custom AI Providers | Live | OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama support |
| Stateless Processing | Live | Serverless API with no persistence |
| Instant Revocation | Live | User can revoke anytime |
| Local Models | Planned | WebLLM / Ollama support |
| TEE Inference | Research | Hardware-secured AI processing |

---

### 8. **Key Technical Decisions**

1. **Encryption Key Derivation**: Uses wallet signature + HKDF to derive deterministic AES-256 key
2. **Authorization Storage**: Stored in user's vault as dynamic fields (user always owns vault)
3. **Stateless API**: No server-side persistence, only processes requests
4. **Custom Providers**: Users bring their own API keys, stored only in browser localStorage
5. **Blob Storage**: Encrypted data stored on Walrus, references stored on-chain
6. **Dynamic Fields**: Used for unlimited blob and authorization storage

### 9. **Environment Configuration**

**Required:**
- `NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID`: Deployed contract package ID

### 10. **Dependencies**

- `@mysten/dapp-kit`: ^1.0.1 (Wallet integration)
- `openai`: ^6.17.0 (OpenAI-compatible client)
- `next`: 16.1.6 (Framework)
- `react`: 19.2.3

**Core Objects:**
- `DataVault`: User's owned object containing:

  - `created_at`: Creation timestamp
  - Dynamic fields for authorizations and blob references

- `Authorization`: Stored in vault's dynamic field:
  - `provider`: Authorized party address
  - `scope`: 1=read, 2=read-write
  - `expires_at`: Expiration time (0=never)
  - `created_at`: Creation timestamp

- `BlobRef`: Stored in vault's dynamic field:
  - `blob_id`: Walrus blob ID
  - `blob_type`: 0=conversation, 1=file
  - `iv`: AES-GCM initialization vector
  - `created_at`: Creation timestamp

- `store_blob()`: Stores blob reference with IV
- `delete_blob()`: Removes blob reference
- `grant_access()`: Adds authorization to vault
- `revoke_access()`: Removes authorization from vault
- `is_authorized()`: Checks if provider is authorized (with expiration check)

- `get_blob_ref()`: Returns blob details
- `get_vault_info()`: Returns blob count and creation time
- `blob_exists()`: Checks if blob exists
- `auth_exists()`: Checks if authorization exists

- Events emitted for all state changes

Client-side encryption, decentralized storage, and blockchain-based access control on Sui. 6â†’ 7â†’[![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) 8â†’ 9â†’[English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) 10â†’ 11â†’--- 12â†’ 13â†’ 14â†’ 15â†’## Author's Philosophy 16â†’ 17â†’### Why MindVault? 18â†’ 19â†’When we use ChatGPT, Claude, or other AI services, there's an uncomfortable reality: 20â†’- Your conversation history is stored on the provider's servers 21â†’- You don't know who can access your data, or if it's used for training 22â†’- You can't truly delete or migrate your data 23â†’ 24â†’MindVault was built to answer one question: **Who should own AI conversation data?** 25â†’ 26â†’Our answer: **The user.** 27â†’ 28â†’### An Honest Disclosure 29â†’ 30â†’We believe in transparency. Here's exactly what MindVault can and cannot do: 31â†’ 32â†’**What We Can Do:** 33â†’- Encrypt your conversations before storage - the platform never sees plaintext 34â†’- Store data on decentralized infrastructure you control (Walrus) 35â†’- Manage access permissions on-chain with instant revocation (Sui) 36â†’- Process AI requests statelessly - no server-side data retention 37â†’- Let you export, delete, or migrate your data freely 38â†’ 39â†’**What We Cannot Do (Yet):** 40â†’- Hide your messages from the AI provider during inference - they need to see plaintext to process it 41â†’- This is a fundamental limitation of current LLM technology, not something we can bypass 42â†’ 43â†’### Future Direction 44â†’ 45â†’We're researching next-generation privacy AI technologies: 46â†’- **TEE (Trusted Execution Environment)**: Run AI inference in hardware-secured enclaves where even operators can't see your data 47â†’- **Local Models**: Support running open-source models locally so your data never leaves your device 48â†’ 49â†’MindVault aims to become **privacy AI infrastructure**, progressively achieving true end-to-end privacy as technology evolves. 50â†’ 51â†’--- 52â†’ 53â†’## User Story 54â†’ 55â†’### The Problem 56â†’ 57â†’Alex is a freelancer who uses AI assistants to: 58â†’- Organize client requirements 59â†’- Draft contracts and emails 60â†’- Brainstorm product ideas 61â†’ 62â†’But Alex has a concern: these conversations contain client-sensitive information, business ideas, and even private thoughts. Alex logs in with a Sui wallet - no registration needed 69â†’2. **Encrypted Storage**: Every message is encrypted in the browser before being stored 70â†’3. **Keys in Your Hands**: The encryption key The keys are stored in localStorage and never sent to our servers for storage. 230â†’ 231â†’--- 232â†’ 233â†’## Smart Contract 234â†’ 235â†’The `DataVault` contract uses Sui's native features for maximum user control: 236â†’ 237â†’### Core Design 238â†’ 239â†’- **Owned Objects**: DataVault is owned by the user, ensuring 100% control 240â†’- **Dynamic Fields**: Authorization and blob references stored as dynamic fields 241â†’- **Instant Revocation**: Users can revoke access anytime since auth data lives in their vault 242â†’ 243â†’### Key Functions 244â†’ 245â†’```move 246â†’// Create a new vault 247â†’public entry fun create_vault(clock: &Clock, ctx: &mut TxContext) 248â†’ 249â†’// Store encrypted blob reference 250â†’public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, blob_type: u8, iv: vector, ...) 251â†’ 252â†’// Grant access to a provider (stores auth in user's vault) 253â†’public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, scope: u8, expires_at: u64, ...) 254â†’ 255â†’// Revoke access (user can always do this unilaterally) 256â†’public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) 257â†’ 258â†’// Check if provider is authorized (view function) 259â†’public fun is_authorized(vault: &DataVault, provider: address, clock: &Clock): bool 260â†’``` 261â†’ 262â†’### Deployed Contract (Testnet) 263â†’ 264â†’- file.content: # MindVault > **Your Data, Your Rules.** | **ä½ çš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œä½ åšä¸»ã€‚** AI conversations you truly own. Client-side encryption, decentralized storage, and blockchain-based access control on Sui. [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Author's Philosophy ### Why MindVault? When we use ChatGPT, Claude, or other AI services, there's an uncomfortable reality: - Your conversation history is stored on the provider's servers - You don't know who can access your data, or if it's used for training - You can't truly delete or migrate your data MindVault was built to answer one question: **Who should own AI conversation data?** Our answer: **The user.** ### An Honest Disclosure We believe in transparency. Here's exactly what MindVault can and cannot do: **What We Can Do:** - Encrypt your conversations before storage - the platform never sees plaintext - Store data on decentralized infrastructure you control (Walrus) - Manage access permissions on-chain with instant revocation (Sui) - Process AI requests statelessly - no server-side data retention - Let you export, delete, or migrate your data freely **What We Cannot Do (Yet):** - Hide your messages from the AI provider during inference - they need to see plaintext to process it - This is a fundamental limitation of current LLM technology, not something we can bypass ### Future Direction We're researching next-generation privacy AI technologies: - **TEE (Trusted Execution Environment)**: Run AI inference in hardware-secured enclaves where even operators can't see your data - **Local Models**: Support running open-source models locally so your data never leaves your device MindVault aims to become **privacy AI infrastructure**, progressively achieving true end-to-end privacy as technology evolves. --- ## User Story ### The Problem Alex is a freelancer who uses AI assistants to: - Organize client requirements - Draft contracts and emails - Brainstorm product ideas But Alex has a concern: these conversations contain client-sensitive information, business ideas, and even private thoughts. Alex doesn't know how long the data is stored, if it's used for training, or who might access it. ### The MindVault Solution With MindVault: 1. **Connect Wallet**: Alex logs in with a Sui wallet - no registration needed 2. **Encrypted Storage**: Every message is encrypted in the browser before being stored 3. **Keys in Your Hands**: The encryption key is derived from Alex's wallet signature - only Alex can decrypt 4. **Full Control**: Alex can delete any conversation instantly, without "requesting" deletion 5. **Fully Portable**: If a better service comes along, Alex can export all data and take it Alex can finally discuss sensitive topics with AI confidently - not because the AI can't see it (it still does during inference), but because the data is **completely under Alex's control** and won't persist on some unknown server forever. --- ## Current Features | Feature | Status | Description | |---------|--------|-------------| | Wallet Connection | Live | Sui Wallet, Suiet, and more | | Client-Side Encryption | Live | AES-256-GCM, key derived from wallet signature | | Decentralized Storage | Live | Walrus testnet integration | | On-Chain Access Control | Live | Sui smart contract for permissions | | Instant Revocation | Live | User can unilaterally revoke any authorization | | Custom AI Providers | Live | Bring your own API key (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, etc.) | | Stateless Processing | Live | API layer never persists any data | | Local Models | Planned | WebLLM / Ollama support | | TEE Inference | Research | Hardware-secured AI processing | --- ## Architecture ### Dual-Layer Privacy Model ``` Web3 â”‚ â”‚ Stateless Enclave â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤ â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤ â”‚ Sui Blockchain â”‚ â”‚ Next.js API Routes (Serverless) â”‚ â”‚ - DataVault Object â”‚ â”‚ - READ: Receive decrypted plaintext â”‚ â”‚ - Authorization (Dynamic) â”‚ â”‚ - PROCESS: Call LLM â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ - FORGET: Memory released, no persistenceâ”‚ â”‚ Walrus Storage â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ - AES-256 encrypted blobs â”‚ â”‚ LLM APIs: OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, etc â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` --- ## Quick Start ### Prerequisites - Node.js 18+ - Sui CLI (optional, for contract deployment) - Sui Wallet (Sui Wallet, Suiet, etc.) ### 1. Clone the Repository ```bash git clone https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui.git cd MindVault-VibeSui ``` ### 2. Setup Frontend ```bash cd frontend npm install cp .env.example .env.local ``` Edit `.env.local`: ```env NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID=0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6 ``` ### 3. Run Development Server ```bash npm run dev ``` Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) in your browser. ### 4. Configure AI Provider 1. Connect your Sui wallet 2. Go to **Settings** page 3. Configure your AI provider (baseURL, API key, model) 4. Start chatting! --- ## Vercel Deployment ### One-Click Deploy [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) ### Manual Deployment Steps 1. Fork this repository to your GitHub account 2. Create a new project in Vercel - Click "Add New" â†’ "Project" - Select your forked repository 3. **Important Configuration**: - **Root Directory**: `frontend` - **Framework Preset**: `Next.js` - **Build Command**: `npm run build` - **Output Directory**: `.next` 4. Set environment variables: | Variable | Value | Required | |----------|-------|----------| | `NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID` | `0xd8e2b3...` | Yes | 5. Click Deploy ### Custom AI Provider Configuration MindVault supports user-configured AI providers in the Settings page - no code changes needed: ``` Settings â†’ AI Provider Configuration â”œâ”€â”€ API Base URL: https://api.openai.com/v1 (or any compatible endpoint) â”œâ”€â”€ API Key: sk-xxx... (stored in browser localStorage only) â””â”€â”€ Model: gpt-4o / claude-sonnet-4-20250514 / deepseek-chat / ... ``` **Supported Compatible Endpoints:** - OpenAI API - Anthropic Claude API - Azure OpenAI - DeepSeek - Moonshot - Any OpenAI-compatible API (e.g., local Ollama) ### FAQ **Q: Deployment fails with "No Next.js version detected"** A: Make sure Root Directory is set to `frontend`, not the project root. **Q: How do I update the deployed contract address?** A: Go to Vercel project settings â†’ Environment Variables, modify `NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID`, then redeploy. **Q: Do I need server-side API keys?** A: No. Users configure their own API keys in the browser. The keys are stored in localStorage and never sent to our servers for storage. --- ## Smart Contract The `DataVault` contract uses Sui's native features for maximum user control: ### Core Design - **Owned Objects**: DataVault is owned by the user, ensuring 100% control - **Dynamic Fields**: Authorization and blob references stored as dynamic fields - **Instant Revocation**: Users can revoke access anytime since auth data lives in their vault ### Key Functions ```move // Create a new vault public entry fun create_vault(clock: &Clock, ctx: &mut TxContext) // Store encrypted blob reference public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, blob_type: u8, iv: vector, ...) // Grant access to a provider (stores auth in user's vault) public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, scope: u8, expires_at: u64, ...) // Revoke access (user can always do this unilaterally) public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) // Check if provider is authorized (view function) public fun is_authorized(vault: &DataVault, provider: address, clock: &Clock): bool ``` ### Deployed Contract (Testnet) - **Package ID**: `0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6` - **Transaction**: `AdH8tBSVJ87FRG8tPuG2NDSUtX9F4ExBwZ9SuDt5Q4M6` ### Deploy Your Own ```bash cd contracts/data_vault sui client publish --gas-budget 100000000 ``` --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Technology | |-------|------------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS | | Blockchain | Sui, Move 2024 | | Storage | Walrus | | AI | Any OpenAI-compatible API | | Deployment | Vercel | --- ## Project Structure ``` MindVault-VibeSui/ â”œâ”€â”€ contracts/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ data_vault/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ Move.toml â”‚ â””â”€â”€ sources/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ data_vault.move # Sui smart contract â”œâ”€â”€ frontend/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ src/ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ app/ # Next.js pages â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ api/chat/ # AI chat API route â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ chat/ # Chat page â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ dashboard/ # Dashboard page â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ settings/ # Settings page â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ components/ # React components â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ hooks/ # Custom hooks â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ lib/ # Utilities (encryption, sui, walrus) â”‚ â””â”€â”€ package.json â”œâ”€â”€ README.md â””â”€â”€ AI_DISCLOSURE.md ``` --- ## Security Model 1. **Encryption Key**: Derived from wallet signature using HKDF, never stored on any server 2. **Data at Rest**: AES-256-GCM encrypted on Walrus, only user can decrypt 3. **Access Control**: On-chain authorization stored in user's vault, instant revocation 4. **Processing**: Stateless serverless functions, no database, no logs, no persistence 5. **API Keys**: User-provided, stored only in browser localStorage --- ## License MIT License --- ## Links - [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui) - [Sui Documentation](https://docs.sui.io/) - [Walrus Documentation](https://docs.walrus.site/) --- # MindVault: éšç§AI APIç½‘å…³ > **ä½ çš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œä½ åšä¸»ã€‚** çœŸæ­£å±äºä½ çš„AIå¯¹è¯ã€‚å®¢æˆ·ç«¯åŠ å¯†ã€å»ä¸­å¿ƒåŒ–å­˜å‚¨ã€åŸºäºSuiåŒºå—é“¾çš„è®¿é—®æ§åˆ¶ã€‚ --- ## ä½œè€…æ€è·¯ ### ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆåš MindVault? å½“æˆ‘ä»¬ä½¿ç”¨ ChatGPTã€Claude ç­‰ AI æœåŠ¡æ—¶ï¼Œæœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªå°´å°¬çš„äº‹å®ï¼š - ## Current Features

| Feature | Status | Description |
|---------|--------|-------------|
| Wallet Connection | Live | Sui Wallet, Suiet, and more |
| Client-Side Encryption | Live | AES-256-GCM, key derived from wallet signature |
| Decentralized Storage | Live | Walrus testnet integration |
| On-Chain Access Control | Live | Sui smart contract for permissions |
| Instant Revocation | Live | User can unilaterally revoke any authorization |
| Custom AI Providers | Live | Bring your own API key (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, etc.) |
| Stateless Processing | Live | API layer never persists any data |
| **Chat History Loading** | **Live** | **Load and decrypt past conversations from Walrus** |
| **Proof Verification** | **Live** | **Generate and verify conversation authenticity proofs** |
| Local Models | Planned | WebLLM / Ollama support |
| TEE Inference | Research | Hardware-secured AI processing |

---

## New: Conversation Proofs

MindVault now supports **conversation proofs** - cryptographic evidence that a conversation was stored on-chain at a specific time.

### Why Proofs Matter

- **Authenticity**: Prove a conversation happened at a specific time
- **Tamper-proof**: On-chain timestamps cannot be forged
- **Verifiable**: Anyone can verify without seeing the content
- **Portable**: Export and share proofs as JSON files

### How to Use

1. **Export a Proof**: Click the "Proof" button on any encrypted message
2. **Verify a Proof**: Go to `/verify` and paste the proof JSON
3. **Share**: Send the proof file to anyone who needs to verify

### What's Verified

- Vault exists on Sui blockchain
- Blob exists on Walrus storage
- Timestamp is valid
- Transaction (if provided) matches the proof

## New: Conversation Proofs

toolUseResult.originalFile: # MindVault > **Your Data, Your Rules.** | **ä½ çš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œä½ åšä¸»ã€‚** AI conversations you truly own. Client-side encryption, decentralized storage, and blockchain-based access control on Sui. [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Author's Philosophy ### Why MindVault? When we use ChatGPT, Claude, or other AI services, there's an uncomfortable reality: - Your conversation history is stored on the provider's servers - You don't know who can access your data, or if it's used for training - You can't truly delete or migrate your data MindVault was built to answer one question: **Who should own AI conversation data?** Our answer: **The user.** ### An Honest Disclosure We believe in transparency. Here's exactly what MindVault can and cannot do: **What We Can Do:** - Encrypt your conversations before storage - the platform never sees plaintext - Store data on decentralized infrastructure you control (Walrus) - Manage access permissions on-chain with instant revocation (Sui) - Process AI requests statelessly - no server-side data retention - Let you export, delete, or migrate your data freely **What We Cannot Do (Yet):** - Hide your messages from the AI provider during inference - they need to see plaintext to process it - This is a fundamental limitation of current LLM technology, not something we can bypass ### Future Direction We're researching next-generation privacy AI technologies: - **TEE (Trusted Execution Environment)**: Run AI inference in hardware-secured enclaves where even operators can't see your data - **Local Models**: Support running open-source models locally so your data never leaves your device MindVault aims to become **privacy AI infrastructure**, progressively achieving true end-to-end privacy as technology evolves. --- ## User Story ### The Problem Alex is a freelancer who uses AI assistants to: - Organize client requirements - Draft contracts and emails - Brainstorm product ideas But Alex has a concern: these conversations contain client-sensitive information, business ideas, and even private thoughts. Alex doesn't know how long the data is stored, if it's used for training, or who might access it. ### The MindVault Solution With MindVault: 1. **Connect Wallet**: Alex logs in with a Sui wallet - no registration needed 2. **Encrypted Storage**: Every message is encrypted in the browser before being stored 3. **Keys in Your Hands**: The encryption key is derived from Alex's wallet signature - only Alex can decrypt 4. **Full Control**: Alex can delete any conversation instantly, without "requesting" deletion 5. **Fully Portable**: If a better service comes along, Alex can export all data and take it Alex can finally discuss sensitive topics with AI confidently - not because the AI can't see it (it still does during inference), but because the data is **completely under Alex's control** and won't persist on some unknown server forever. --- ## Current Features | Feature | Status | Description | |---------|--------|-------------| | Wallet Connection | Live | Sui Wallet, Suiet, and more | | Client-Side Encryption | Live | AES-256-GCM, key derived from wallet signature | | Decentralized Storage | Live | Walrus testnet integration | | On-Chain Access Control | Live | Sui smart contract for permissions | | Instant Revocation | Live | User can unilaterally revoke any authorization | | Custom AI Providers | Live | Bring your own API key (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, etc.) | | Stateless Processing | Live | API layer never persists any data | | Local Models | Planned | WebLLM / Ollama support | | TEE Inference | Research | Hardware-secured AI processing | --- ## Architecture ### Dual-Layer Privacy Model ``` â”‚ - DataVault Object â”‚ â”‚ - READ: Receive decrypted plaintext â”‚ â”‚ - Authorization (Dynamic) â”‚ â”‚ - PROCESS: Call LLM â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ - FORGET: Memory released, no persistenceâ”‚ â”‚ Walrus Storage â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ - AES-256 encrypted blobs â”‚ â”‚ LLM APIs: OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, etc â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` --- ## Quick Start ### Prerequisites - Node.js 18+ - Sui CLI (optional, for contract deployment) - Sui Wallet (Sui Wallet, Suiet, etc.) ### 1. Clone the Repository ```bash git clone https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui.git cd MindVault-VibeSui ``` ### 2. Setup Frontend ```bash cd frontend npm install cp .env.example .env.local ``` Edit `.env.local`: ```env NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID=0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6 ``` ### 3. Run Development Server ```bash npm run dev ``` Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) in your browser. ### 4. Configure AI Provider 1. Connect your Sui wallet 2. Go to **Settings** page 3. Configure your AI provider (baseURL, API key, model) 4. Start chatting! --- ## Vercel Deployment ### One-Click Deploy [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) ### Manual Deployment Steps 1. Fork this repository to your GitHub account 2. Create a new project in Vercel - Click "Add New" â†’ "Project" - Select your forked repository 3. **Important Configuration**: - **Root Directory**: `frontend` - **Framework Preset**: `Next.js` - **Build Command**: `npm run build` - **Output Directory**: `.next` 4. Set environment variables: | Variable | Value | Required | |----------|-------|----------| | `NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID` | `0xd8e2b3...` | Yes | 5. Click Deploy ### Custom AI Provider Configuration MindVault supports user-configured AI providers in the Settings page - no code changes needed: ``` Settings â†’ AI Provider Configuration â”œâ”€â”€ API Base URL: https://api.openai.com/v1 (or any compatible endpoint) â”œâ”€â”€ API Key: sk-xxx... (stored in browser localStorage only) â””â”€â”€ Model: gpt-4o / claude-sonnet-4-20250514 / deepseek-chat / ... ``` **Supported Compatible Endpoints:** - OpenAI API - Anthropic Claude API - Azure OpenAI - DeepSeek - Moonshot - Any OpenAI-compatible API (e.g., local Ollama) ### FAQ **Q: Deployment fails with "No Next.js version detected"** A: Make sure Root Directory is set to `frontend`, not the project root. **Q: How do I update the deployed contract address?** A: Go to Vercel project settings â†’ Environment Variables, modify `NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID`, then redeploy. **Q: Do I need server-side API keys?** A: No. Users configure their own API keys in the browser. The keys are stored in localStorage and never sent to our servers for storage. --- ## Smart Contract The `DataVault` contract uses Sui's native features for maximum user control: ### Core Design - **Owned Objects**: DataVault is owned by the user, ensuring 100% control - **Dynamic Fields**: Authorization and blob references stored as dynamic fields - **Instant Revocation**: Users can revoke access anytime since auth data lives in their vault ### Key Functions ```move // Create a new vault public entry fun create_vault(clock: &Clock, ctx: &mut TxContext) // Store encrypted blob reference public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, blob_type: u8, iv: vector, ...) // Grant access to a provider (stores auth in user's vault) public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, scope: u8, expires_at: u64, ...) // Revoke access (user can always do this unilaterally) public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) // Check if provider is authorized (view function) public fun is_authorized(vault: &DataVault, provider: address, clock: &Clock): bool ``` ### Deployed Contract (Testnet) - **Package ID**: `0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6` - **Transaction**: `AdH8tBSVJ87FRG8tPuG2NDSUtX9F4ExBwZ9SuDt5Q4M6` ### Deploy Your Own ```bash cd contracts/data_vault sui client publish --gas-budget 100000000 ``` --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Technology | |-------|------------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS | | Blockchain | Sui, Move 2024 | | Storage | Walrus | | AI | Any OpenAI-compatible API | | Deployment | Vercel | --- ## Project Structure ``` MindVault-VibeSui/ â”œâ”€â”€ contracts/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ data_vault/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ Move.toml â”‚ â””â”€â”€ sources/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ data_vault.move # Sui smart contract â”œâ”€â”€ frontend/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ src/ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ app/ # Next.js pages â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ api/chat/ # AI chat API route â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ chat/ # Chat page â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ dashboard/ # Dashboard page â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ settings/ # Settings page â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ components/ # React components â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ hooks/ # Custom hooks â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ lib/ # Utilities (encryption, sui, walrus) â”‚ â””â”€â”€ package.json â”œâ”€â”€ README.md â””â”€â”€ AI_DISCLOSURE.md ``` --- ## Security Model 1. **Encryption Key**: Derived from wallet signature using HKDF, never stored on any server 2. **Data at Rest**: AES-256-GCM encrypted on Walrus, only user can decrypt 3. **Access Control**: On-chain authorization stored in user's vault, instant revocation 4. **Processing**: Stateless serverless functions, no database, no logs, no persistence 5. **API Keys**: User-provided, stored only in browser localStorage --- ## License MIT License --- ## Links - [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui) - [Sui Documentation](https://docs.sui.io/) - [Walrus Documentation](https://docs.walrus.site/) --- # MindVault: éšç§AI APIç½‘å…³ > **ä½ çš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œä½ åšä¸»ã€‚** çœŸæ­£å±äºä½ çš„AIå¯¹è¯ã€‚å®¢æˆ·ç«¯åŠ å¯†ã€å»ä¸­å¿ƒåŒ–å­˜å‚¨ã€åŸºäºSuiåŒºå—é“¾çš„è®¿é—®æ§åˆ¶ã€‚ --- ## ä½œè€…æ€è·¯ ### ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆåš MindVault? å½“æˆ‘ä»¬ä½¿ç”¨ ChatGPTã€Claude ç­‰ AI æœåŠ¡æ—¶ï¼Œæœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªå°´å°¬çš„äº‹å®ï¼š - lines: | Instant Revocation | Live | User can unilaterally revoke any authorization |
| Custom AI Providers | Live | Bring your own API key (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, etc.) |
| Stateless Processing | Live | API layer never persists any data |
+| **Chat History Loading** | **Live** | **Load and decrypt past conversations from Walrus** |
+| **Proof Verification** | **Live** | **Generate and verify conversation authenticity proofs** |
| Local Models | Planned | WebLLM / Ollama support |
| TEE Inference | Research | Hardware-secured AI processing |
+MindVault now supports **conversation proofs** - cryptographic evidence that a conversation was stored on-chain at a specific time.
+- **Authenticity**: Prove a conversation happened at a specific time
+- **Verifiable**: Anyone can verify without seeing the content
+- **Portable**: Export and share proofs as JSON files
+1. **Export a Proof**: Click the "Proof" button on any encrypted message
+2. **Verify a Proof**: Go to `/verify` and paste the proof JSON
+3. **Share**: Send the proof file to anyone who needs to verify

toolUseResult.originalFile: # MindVault > **Your Data, Your Rules.** | **ä½ çš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œä½ åšä¸»ã€‚** AI conversations you truly own. Client-side encryption, decentralized storage, and blockchain-based access control on Sui. [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Author's Philosophy ### Why MindVault? When we use ChatGPT, Claude, or other AI services, there's an uncomfortable reality: - Your conversation history is stored on the provider's servers - You don't know who can access your data, or if it's used for training - You can't truly delete or migrate your data MindVault was built to answer one question: **Who should own AI conversation data?** Our answer: **The user.** ### An Honest Disclosure We believe in transparency. Here's exactly what MindVault can and cannot do: **What We Can Do:** - Encrypt your conversations before storage - the platform never sees plaintext - Store data on decentralized infrastructure you control (Walrus) - Manage access permissions on-chain with instant revocation (Sui) - Process AI requests statelessly - no server-side data retention - Let you export, delete, or migrate your data freely **What We Cannot Do (Yet):** - Hide your messages from the AI provider during inference - they need to see plaintext to process it - This is a fundamental limitation of current LLM technology, not something we can bypass ### Future Direction We're researching next-generation privacy AI technologies: - **TEE (Trusted Execution Environment)**: Run AI inference in hardware-secured enclaves where even operators can't see your data - **Local Models**: Support running open-source models locally so your data never leaves your device MindVault aims to become **privacy AI infrastructure**, progressively achieving true end-to-end privacy as technology evolves. --- ## User Story ### The Problem Alex is a freelancer who uses AI assistants to: - Organize client requirements - Draft contracts and emails - Brainstorm product ideas But Alex has a concern: these conversations contain client-sensitive information, business ideas, and even private thoughts. Alex doesn't know how long the data is stored, if it's used for training, or who might access it. ### The MindVault Solution With MindVault: 1. **Connect Wallet**: Alex logs in with a Sui wallet - no registration needed 2. **Encrypted Storage**: Every message is encrypted in the browser before being stored 3. **Keys in Your Hands**: The encryption key is derived from Alex's wallet signature - only Alex can decrypt 4. **Full Control**: Alex can delete any conversation instantly, without "requesting" deletion 5. **Fully Portable**: If a better service comes along, Alex can export all data and take it Alex can finally discuss sensitive topics with AI confidently - not because the AI can't see it (it still does during inference), but because the data is **completely under Alex's control** and won't persist on some unknown server forever. --- ## Current Features | Feature | Status | Description | |---------|--------|-------------| | Wallet Connection | Live | Sui Wallet, Suiet, and more | | Client-Side Encryption | Live | AES-256-GCM, key derived from wallet signature | | Decentralized Storage | Live | Walrus testnet integration | | On-Chain Access Control | Live | Sui smart contract for permissions | | Instant Revocation | Live | User can unilaterally revoke any authorization | | Custom AI Providers | Live | Bring your own API key (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, etc.) | | Stateless Processing | Live | API layer never persists any data | | **Chat History Loading** | **Live** | **Load and decrypt past conversations from Walrus** | | **Proof Verification** | **Live** | **Generate and verify conversation authenticity proofs** | | Local Models | Planned | WebLLM / Ollama support | | TEE Inference | Research | Hardware-secured AI processing | --- ## New: Conversation Proofs MindVault now supports **conversation proofs** - cryptographic evidence that a conversation was stored on-chain at a specific time. ### Why Proofs Matter - **Authenticity**: Prove a conversation happened at a specific time - **Tamper-proof**: On-chain timestamps cannot be forged - **Verifiable**: Anyone can verify without seeing the content - **Portable**: Export and share proofs as JSON files ### How to Use 1. **Export a Proof**: Click the "Proof" button on any encrypted message 2. **Verify a Proof**: Go to `/verify` and paste the proof JSON 3. **Share**: Send the proof file to anyone who needs to verify ### What's Verified - Vault exists on Sui blockchain - Blob exists on Walrus storage - Timestamp is valid - Transaction (if provided) matches the proof --- ## Architecture ### Dual-Layer Privacy Model ``` Storage â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ - AES-256 encrypted blobs â”‚ â”‚ LLM APIs: OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, etc â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` --- ## Quick Start ### Prerequisites - Node.js 18+ - Sui CLI (optional, for contract deployment) - Sui Wallet (Sui Wallet, Suiet, etc.) ### 1. Clone the Repository ```bash git clone https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui.git cd MindVault-VibeSui ``` ### 2. Setup Frontend ```bash cd frontend npm install cp .env.example .env.local ``` Edit `.env.local`: ```env NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID=0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6 ``` ### 3. Run Development Server ```bash npm run dev ``` Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) in your browser. ### 4. Configure AI Provider 1. Connect your Sui wallet 2. Go to **Settings** page 3. Configure your AI provider (baseURL, API key, model) 4. Start chatting! --- ## Vercel Deployment ### One-Click Deploy [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) ### Manual Deployment Steps 1. Fork this repository to your GitHub account 2. Create a new project in Vercel - Click "Add New" â†’ "Project" - Select your forked repository 3. **Important Configuration**: - **Root Directory**: `frontend` - **Framework Preset**: `Next.js` - **Build Command**: `npm run build` - **Output Directory**: `.next` 4. Set environment variables: | Variable | Value | Required | |----------|-------|----------| | `NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID` | `0xd8e2b3...` | Yes | 5. Click Deploy ### Custom AI Provider Configuration MindVault supports user-configured AI providers in the Settings page - no code changes needed: ``` Settings â†’ AI Provider Configuration â”œâ”€â”€ API Base URL: https://api.openai.com/v1 (or any compatible endpoint) â”œâ”€â”€ API Key: sk-xxx... (stored in browser localStorage only) â””â”€â”€ Model: gpt-4o / claude-sonnet-4-20250514 / deepseek-chat / ... ``` **Supported Compatible Endpoints:** - OpenAI API - Anthropic Claude API - Azure OpenAI - DeepSeek - Moonshot - Any OpenAI-compatible API (e.g., local Ollama) ### FAQ **Q: Deployment fails with "No Next.js version detected"** A: Make sure Root Directory is set to `frontend`, not the project root. **Q: How do I update the deployed contract address?** A: Go to Vercel project settings â†’ Environment Variables, modify `NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID`, then redeploy. **Q: Do I need server-side API keys?** A: No. Users configure their own API keys in the browser. The keys are stored in localStorage and never sent to our servers for storage. --- ## Smart Contract The `DataVault` contract uses Sui's native features for maximum user control: ### Core Design - **Owned Objects**: DataVault is owned by the user, ensuring 100% control - **Dynamic Fields**: Authorization and blob references stored as dynamic fields - **Instant Revocation**: Users can revoke access anytime since auth data lives in their vault ### Key Functions ```move // Create a new vault public entry fun create_vault(clock: &Clock, ctx: &mut TxContext) // Store encrypted blob reference public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, blob_type: u8, iv: vector, ...) // Grant access to a provider (stores auth in user's vault) public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, scope: u8, expires_at: u64, ...) // Revoke access (user can always do this unilaterally) public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) // Check if provider is authorized (view function) public fun is_authorized(vault: &DataVault, provider: address, clock: &Clock): bool ``` ### Deployed Contract (Testnet) - **Package ID**: `0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6` - **Transaction**: `AdH8tBSVJ87FRG8tPuG2NDSUtX9F4ExBwZ9SuDt5Q4M6` ### Deploy Your Own ```bash cd contracts/data_vault sui client publish --gas-budget 100000000 ``` --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Technology | |-------|------------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS | | Blockchain | Sui, Move 2024 | | Storage | Walrus | | AI | Any OpenAI-compatible API | | Deployment | Vercel | --- ## Project Structure ``` MindVault-VibeSui/ â”œâ”€â”€ contracts/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ data_vault/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ Move.toml â”‚ â””â”€â”€ sources/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ data_vault.move # Sui smart contract â”œâ”€â”€ frontend/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ src/ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ app/ # Next.js pages â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ api/chat/ # AI chat API route â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ chat/ # Chat page â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ dashboard/ # Dashboard page â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ settings/ # Settings page â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ components/ # React components â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ hooks/ # Custom hooks â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ lib/ # Utilities (encryption, sui, walrus) â”‚ â””â”€â”€ package.json â”œâ”€â”€ README.md â””â”€â”€ AI_DISCLOSURE.md ``` --- ## Security Model 1. **Encryption Key**: Derived from wallet signature using HKDF, never stored on any server 2. **Data at Rest**: AES-256-GCM encrypted on Walrus, only user can decrypt 3. **Access Control**: On-chain authorization stored in user's vault, instant revocation 4. **Processing**: Stateless serverless functions, no database, no logs, no persistence 5. **API Keys**: User-provided, stored only in browser localStorage --- ## License MIT License --- ## Links - content.text:
All tasks are completed. Let me provide a summary of what was implemented.

## Implementation Complete

I've successfully implemented the MindVault plan with the following features:

### 1. History Loading from Walrus
- **`frontend/src/lib/sui.ts`**: Added `getAllBlobRefs()` and `getBlobRef()` functions to query blob references from vault's dynamic fields
- **`frontend/src/hooks/useVault.ts`**: Added `loadHistory()` method that fetches blob refs from chain, downloads encrypted data from Walrus, and decrypts it
- **`frontend/src/components/ChatInterface.tsx`**: 
  - Auto-loads history when vault and encryption are ready
  - Added "Load History" button in the toolbar
  - Messages now store structured data (role, content, timestamp)
  - Full history is sent as context to AI (not just last 10 messages)

### 2. Proof Verification System
- **`frontend/src/lib/proof.ts`**: New library with:
  - `generateProof()` - Creates cryptographic proof of conversation
  - `verifyProof()` - Verifies proof against on-chain data
  - `downloadProof()` - Exports proof as JSON file
  - `sha256()` - Content hashing utility
- **`frontend/src/app/verify/page.tsx`**: New verification page where users can:
  - Paste proof JSON
  - Verify against Sui blockchain and Walrus storage
  - See detailed verification checks
  - View proof details with links to Sui explorer

### 3. Export Proof Button
- Added "Proof" button on each encrypted message in ChatInterface
- Clicking exports a JSON proof file with:
  - Vault ID and owner
  - Blob ID and index
  - Chain timestamp
  - Content hash (SHA-256)
  - Network and package info

### 4. Navigation Update
- **`frontend/src/components/Header.tsx`**: Added "Verify" link to navigation

### 5. README Updates
- Added new features to the feature table (Chat History Loading, Proof Verification)
- Added "Conversation Proofs" section explaining:
  - Why proofs matter
  - How to use them
  - What gets verified
- Updated both English and Chinese sections

### Build Status
The project builds successfully with all new features.

git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
feat: Add chat history loading and proof verification

- Add getAllBlobRefs() and getBlobRef() to query blob refs from chain
- Add loadHistory() method to useVault hook for loading encrypted history
- Update ChatInterface to auto-load history and store structured messages
- Create proof.ts library for generating and verifying conversation proofs
- Add /verify page for proof verification with Sui explorer links
- Add "Proof" export button on encrypted messages
- Add "Verify" link to navigation header
- Update README with new features documentation (EN/CN)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

input.command:
git add frontend/src/components/Providers.tsx frontend/src/hooks/useEncryption.ts frontend/src/lib/encryption.ts && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
fix: Improve wallet connection and encryption persistence

- Add explicit storage config to WalletProvider for better connection persistence
- Cache encryption signature in sessionStorage to avoid repeated signing
- Auto-restore encryption key from cache when wallet reconnects
- Clear signature cache when encryption is cleared

This improves UX by reducing the number of wallet signature requests
during a browser session.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

content.content: 1â†’# MindVault 2â†’ 3â†’> **Your Data, Your Rules.** | **ä½ çš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œä½ åšä¸»ã€‚** 4â†’ 5â†’AI conversations you truly own. Client-side encryption, decentralized storage, and blockchain-based access control on Sui. 6â†’ 7â†’[![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) 8â†’ 9â†’[English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) 10â†’ 11â†’--- 12â†’ 13â†’ 14â†’ 15â†’## Author's Philosophy 16â†’ 17â†’### Why MindVault? 18â†’ 19â†’When we use ChatGPT, Claude, or other AI services, there's an uncomfortable reality: 20â†’- Your conversation history is stored on the provider's servers 21â†’- You don't know who can access your data, or if it's used for training 22â†’- You can't truly delete or migrate your data 23â†’ 24â†’MindVault was built to answer one question: **Who should own AI conversation data?** 25â†’ 26â†’Our answer: **The user.** 27â†’ 28â†’### An Honest Disclosure 29â†’ 30â†’We believe in transparency. Here's exactly what MindVault can and cannot do: 31â†’ 32â†’**What We Can Do:** 33â†’- Encrypt your conversations before storage - the platform never sees plaintext 34â†’- Store data on decentralized infrastructure you control (Walrus) 35â†’- Manage access permissions on-chain with instant revocation (Sui) 36â†’- Process AI requests statelessly - no server-side data retention 37â†’- Let you export, delete, or migrate your data freely 38â†’ 39â†’**What We Cannot Do (Yet):** 40â†’- Hide your messages from the AI provider during inference - they need to see plaintext to process it 41â†’- This is a fundamental limitation of current LLM technology, not something we can bypass 42â†’ 43â†’### Future Direction 44â†’ 45â†’We're researching next-generation privacy AI technologies: 46â†’- **TEE (Trusted Execution Environment)**: Run AI inference in hardware-secured enclaves where even operators can't see your data 47â†’- **Local Models**: Support running open-source models locally so your data never leaves your device 48â†’ 49â†’MindVault aims to become **privacy AI infrastructure**, progressively achieving true end-to-end privacy as technology evolves. 50â†’ 51â†’--- 52â†’ 53â†’## User Story 54â†’ 55â†’### The Problem 56â†’ 57â†’Alex is a freelancer who uses AI assistants to: 58â†’- Organize client requirements 59â†’- Draft contracts and emails 60â†’- Brainstorm product ideas 61â†’ 62â†’But Alex has a concern: these conversations contain client-sensitive information, business ideas, and even private thoughts. Alex doesn't know how long the data is stored, if it's used for training, or who might access it. 63â†’ 64â†’### The MindVault Solution 65â†’ 66â†’With MindVault: 67â†’ 68â†’1. **Connect Wallet**: Alex logs in with a Sui wallet - no registration needed 69â†’2. **Encrypted Storage**: Every message is encrypted in the browser before being stored 70â†’3. **Keys in Your Hands**: The encryption key is derived from Alex's wallet signature - only Alex can decrypt 71â†’4. **Full Control**: Alex can delete any conversation instantly, without "requesting" deletion 72â†’5. **Fully Portable**: If a better service comes along, Alex can export all data and take it 73â†’ 74â†’Alex can finally discuss sensitive topics with AI confidently - not because the AI can't see it (it still does during inference), but because the data is **completely under Alex's control** and won't persist on some unknown server forever. 75â†’ 76â†’--- 77â†’ 78â†’## Current Features 79â†’ 80â†’| Feature | Status | Description | 81â†’|---------|--------|-------------| 82â†’| Wallet Connection | Live | Sui Wallet, Suiet, and more | 83â†’| Client-Side Encryption | Live | AES-256-GCM, key derived from wallet signature | 84â†’| Decentralized Storage | Live | Walrus testnet integration | 85â†’| On-Chain Access Control | Live | Sui smart contract for permissions | 86â†’| Instant Revocation | Live | User can unilaterally revoke any authorization | 87â†’| Custom AI Providers | Live | Bring your own API key (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, etc.) | 88â†’| Stateless Processing | Live | API layer never persists any data | 89â†’| **Chat History Loading** | **Live** | **Load and decrypt past conversations from Walrus** | 90â†’| **Proof Verification** | **Live** | **Generate and verify conversation authenticity proofs** | 91â†’| Local Models | Planned | WebLLM / Ollama support | 92â†’| TEE Inference | Research | Hardware-secured AI processing | 93â†’ 94â†’--- 95â†’ 96â†’## New: Conversation Proofs 97â†’ 98â†’MindVault now supports **conversation proofs** - cryptographic evidence that a conversation was stored on-chain at a specific time. 99â†’ 100â†’### Why Proofs Matter 101â†’ 102â†’- **Authenticity**: Prove a conversation happened at a specific time 103â†’- **Tamper-proof**: On-chain timestamps cannot be forged 104â†’- **Verifiable**: Anyone can verify without seeing the content 105â†’- **Portable**: Export and share proofs as JSON files 106â†’ 107â†’### How to Use 108â†’ 109â†’1. **Export a Proof**: Click the "Proof" button on any encrypted message 110â†’2. **Verify a Proof**: Go to `/verify` and paste the proof JSON 111â†’3. **Share**: Send the proof file to anyone who needs to verify 112â†’ 113â†’### What's Verified 114â†’ 115â†’- Vault exists on Sui blockchain 116â†’- Blob exists on Walrus storage 117â†’- Timestamp is valid 118â†’- Transaction (if provided) matches the proof 119â†’ 120â†’--- 121â†’ 122â†’## Architecture 123â†’ 124â†’### Dual-Layer Privacy Model 125â†’ 126â†’``` Start chatting! 195â†’ 196â†’--- 197â†’ 198â†’## Vercel Deployment 199â†’ 200â†’### One-Click Deploy 201â†’ 202â†’[![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) 203â†’ 204â†’### Manual Deployment Steps 205â†’ 206â†’1. Fork this repository to your GitHub account 207â†’ 208â†’2. Create a new project in Vercel 209â†’ - Click "Add New" â†’ "Project" 210â†’ - Select your forked repository 211â†’ 212â†’3. **Important Configuration**: 213â†’ - **Root Directory**: `frontend` 214â†’ - **Framework Preset**: `Next.js` 215â†’ - **Build Command**: `npm run build` 216â†’ - **Output Directory**: `.next` 217â†’ 218â†’4. Set environment variables: 219â†’ 220â†’ | Variable | Value | Required | 221â†’ |----------|-------|----------| 222â†’ | `NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID` | `0xd8e2b3...` | Yes | 223â†’ 224â†’5. Click Deploy 225â†’ 226â†’### Custom AI Provider Configuration 227â†’ 228â†’MindVault supports user-configured AI providers in the Settings page - no code changes needed: 229â†’ 230â†’``` 231â†’Settings â†’ AI Provider Configuration 232â†’â”œâ”€â”€ API Base URL: https://api.openai.com/v1 (or any compatible endpoint) 233â†’â”œâ”€â”€ API Key: sk-xxx... (stored in browser localStorage only) 234â†’â””â”€â”€ Model: gpt-4o / claude-sonnet-4-20250514 / deepseek-chat / ... 235â†’``` 236â†’ 237â†’**Supported Compatible Endpoints:** 238â†’- OpenAI API 239â†’- Anthropic Claude API 240â†’- Azure OpenAI 241â†’- DeepSeek 242â†’- Moonshot 243â†’- Any OpenAI-compatible API (e.g., local Ollama) 244â†’ 245â†’### FAQ 246â†’ 247â†’**Q: Deployment fails with "No Next.js version detected"** 248â†’ 249â†’A: Make sure Root Directory is set to `frontend`, not the project root. 250â†’ 251â†’**Q: How do I update the deployed contract address?** 252â†’ 253â†’A: Go to Vercel project settings â†’ Environment Variables, modify `NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID`, then redeploy. 254â†’ 255â†’**Q: Do I need server-side API keys?** 256â†’ 257â†’A: No. Users configure their own API keys in the browser. The keys are stored in localStorage and never sent to our servers for storage. 258â†’ 259â†’--- 260â†’ 261â†’## Smart Contract 262â†’ 263â†’The `DataVault` contract uses Sui's native features for maximum user control: 264â†’ 265â†’### Core Design 266â†’ 267â†’- **Owned Objects**: DataVault is owned by the user, ensuring 100% control 268â†’- **Dynamic Fields**: Authorization and blob references stored as dynamic fields 269â†’- **Instant Revocation**: Users can revoke access anytime since auth data lives in their vault 270â†’ 271â†’### Key Functions 272â†’ 273â†’```move 274â†’// Create a new vault 275â†’public entry fun create_vault(clock: &Clock, ctx: &mut TxContext) 276â†’ 277â†’// Store encrypted blob reference 278â†’public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, blob_type: u8, iv: vector, ...) 279â†’ 280â†’// Grant access to a provider (stores auth in user's vault) 281â†’public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, scope: u8, expires_at: u64, ...) 282â†’ 283â†’// Revoke access (user can always do this unilaterally) 284â†’public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) 285â†’ 286â†’// Check if provider is authorized (view function) 287â†’public fun is_authorized(vault: &DataVault, provider: address, clock: &Clock): bool 288â†’``` 289â†’ 290â†’### Deployed Contract (Testnet) 291â†’ 292â†’- **Package ID**: `0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6` 293â†’- **Transaction**: `AdH8tBSVJ87FRG8tPuG2NDSUtX9F4ExBwZ9SuDt5Q4M6` 294â†’ 295â†’### Deploy Your Own 296â†’ file.content: # MindVault > **Your Data, Your Rules.** | **ä½ çš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œä½ åšä¸»ã€‚** AI conversations you truly own. Client-side encryption, decentralized storage, and blockchain-based access control on Sui. [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Author's Philosophy ### Why MindVault? When we use ChatGPT, Claude, or other AI services, there's an uncomfortable reality: - Your conversation history is stored on the provider's servers - You don't know who can access your data, or if it's used for training - You can't truly delete or migrate your data MindVault was built to answer one question: **Who should own AI conversation data?** Our answer: **The user.** ### An Honest Disclosure We believe in transparency. Here's exactly what MindVault can and cannot do: **What We Can Do:** - Encrypt your conversations before storage - the platform never sees plaintext - Store data on decentralized infrastructure you control (Walrus) - Manage access permissions on-chain with instant revocation (Sui) - Process AI requests statelessly - no server-side data retention - Let you export, delete, or migrate your data freely **What We Cannot Do (Yet):** - Hide your messages from the AI provider during inference - they need to see plaintext to process it - This is a fundamental limitation of current LLM technology, not something we can bypass ### Future Direction We're researching next-generation privacy AI technologies: - **TEE (Trusted Execution Environment)**: Run AI inference in hardware-secured enclaves where even operators can't see your data - **Local Models**: Support running open-source models locally so your data never leaves your device MindVault aims to become **privacy AI infrastructure**, progressively achieving true end-to-end privacy as technology evolves. --- ## User Story ### The Problem Alex is a freelancer who uses AI assistants to: - Organize client requirements - Draft contracts and emails - Brainstorm product ideas But Alex has a concern: these conversations contain client-sensitive information, business ideas, and even private thoughts. Alex doesn't know how long the data is stored, if it's used for training, or who might access it. ### The MindVault Solution With MindVault: 1. **Connect Wallet**: Alex logs in with a Sui wallet - no registration needed 2. **Encrypted Storage**: Every message is encrypted in the browser before being stored 3. **Keys in Your Hands**: The encryption key is derived from Alex's wallet signature - only Alex can decrypt 4. **Full Control**: Alex can delete any conversation instantly, without "requesting" deletion 5. **Fully Portable**: If a better service comes along, Alex can export all data and take it Alex can finally discuss sensitive topics with AI confidently - not because the AI can't see it (it still does during inference), but because the data is **completely under Alex's control** and won't persist on some unknown server forever. --- ## Current Features | Feature | Status | Description | |---------|--------|-------------| | Wallet Connection | Live | Sui Wallet, Suiet, and more | | Client-Side Encryption | Live | AES-256-GCM, key derived from wallet signature | | Decentralized Storage | Live | Walrus testnet integration | | On-Chain Access Control | Live | Sui smart contract for permissions | | Instant Revocation | Live | User can unilaterally revoke any authorization | | Custom AI Providers | Live | Bring your own API key (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, etc.) | | Stateless Processing | Live | API layer never persists any data | | **Chat History Loading** | **Live** | **Load and decrypt past conversations from Walrus** | | **Proof Verification** | **Live** | **Generate and verify conversation authenticity proofs** | | Local Models | Planned | WebLLM / Ollama support | | TEE Inference | Research | Hardware-secured AI processing | --- ## New: Conversation Proofs MindVault now supports **conversation proofs** - cryptographic evidence that a conversation was stored on-chain at a specific time. ### Why Proofs Matter - **Authenticity**: Prove a conversation happened at a specific time - **Tamper-proof**: On-chain timestamps cannot be forged - **Verifiable**: Anyone can verify without seeing the content - **Portable**: Export and share proofs as JSON files ### How to Use 1. **Export a Proof**: Click the "Proof" button on any encrypted message 2. **Verify a Proof**: Go to `/verify` and paste the proof JSON 3. **Share**: Send the proof file to anyone who needs to verify ### What's Verified - Vault exists on Sui blockchain - Blob exists on Walrus storage - Timestamp is valid - Transaction (if provided) matches the proof --- ## Architecture ### Dual-Layer Privacy Model ``` Storage â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ - AES-256 encrypted blobs â”‚ â”‚ LLM APIs: OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, etc â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` --- ## Quick Start ### Prerequisites - Node.js 18+ - Sui CLI (optional, for contract deployment) - Sui Wallet (Sui Wallet, Suiet, etc.) ### 1. Clone the Repository ```bash git clone https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui.git cd MindVault-VibeSui ``` ### 2. Setup Frontend ```bash cd frontend npm install cp .env.example .env.local ``` Edit `.env.local`: ```env NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID=0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6 ``` ### 3. Run Development Server ```bash npm run dev ``` Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) in your browser. ### 4. Configure AI Provider 1. Connect your Sui wallet 2. Go to **Settings** page 3. Configure your AI provider (baseURL, API key, model) 4. Start chatting! --- ## Vercel Deployment ### One-Click Deploy [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) ### Manual Deployment Steps 1. Fork this repository to your GitHub account 2. Create a new project in Vercel - Click "Add New" â†’ "Project" - Select your forked repository 3. **Important Configuration**: - **Root Directory**: `frontend` - **Framework Preset**: `Next.js` - **Build Command**: `npm run build` - **Output Directory**: `.next` 4. Set environment variables: | Variable | Value | Required | |----------|-------|----------| | `NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID` | `0xd8e2b3...` | Yes | 5. Click Deploy ### Custom AI Provider Configuration MindVault supports user-configured AI providers in the Settings page - no code changes needed: ``` Settings â†’ AI Provider Configuration â”œâ”€â”€ API Base URL: https://api.openai.com/v1 (or any compatible endpoint) â”œâ”€â”€ API Key: sk-xxx... (stored in browser localStorage only) â””â”€â”€ Model: gpt-4o / claude-sonnet-4-20250514 / deepseek-chat / ... ``` **Supported Compatible Endpoints:** - OpenAI API - Anthropic Claude API - Azure OpenAI - DeepSeek - Moonshot - Any OpenAI-compatible API (e.g., local Ollama) ### FAQ **Q: Deployment fails with "No Next.js version detected"** A: Make sure Root Directory is set to `frontend`, not the project root. **Q: How do I update the deployed contract address?** A: Go to Vercel project settings â†’ Environment Variables, modify `NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID`, then redeploy. **Q: Do I need server-side API keys?** A: No. Users configure their own API keys in the browser. The keys are stored in localStorage and never sent to our servers for storage. --- ## Smart Contract The `DataVault` contract uses Sui's native features for maximum user control: ### Core Design - **Owned Objects**: DataVault is owned by the user, ensuring 100% control - **Dynamic Fields**: Authorization and blob references stored as dynamic fields - **Instant Revocation**: Users can revoke access anytime since auth data lives in their vault ### Key Functions ```move // Create a new vault public entry fun create_vault(clock: &Clock, ctx: &mut TxContext) // Store encrypted blob reference public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, blob_type: u8, iv: vector, ...) // Grant access to a provider (stores auth in user's vault) public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, scope: u8, expires_at: u64, ...) // Revoke access (user can always do this unilaterally) public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) // Check if provider is authorized (view function) public fun is_authorized(vault: &DataVault, provider: address, clock: &Clock): bool ``` ### Deployed Contract (Testnet) - **Package ID**: `0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6` - **Transaction**: `AdH8tBSVJ87FRG8tPuG2NDSUtX9F4ExBwZ9SuDt5Q4M6` ### Deploy Your Own ```bash cd contracts/data_vault sui client publish --gas-budget 100000000 ``` --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Technology | |-------|------------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS | | Blockchain | Sui, Move 2024 | | Storage | Walrus | | AI | Any OpenAI-compatible API | | Deployment | Vercel | --- ## Project Structure ``` MindVault-VibeSui/ â”œâ”€â”€ contracts/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ data_vault/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ Move.toml â”‚ â””â”€â”€ sources/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ data_vault.move # Sui smart contract â”œâ”€â”€ frontend/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ src/ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ app/ # Next.js pages â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ api/chat/ # AI chat API route â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ chat/ # Chat page â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ dashboard/ # Dashboard page â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ settings/ # Settings page â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ components/ # React components â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ hooks/ # Custom hooks â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ lib/ # Utilities (encryption, sui, walrus) â”‚ â””â”€â”€ package.json â”œâ”€â”€ README.md â””â”€â”€ AI_DISCLOSURE.md ``` --- ## Security Model 1. **Encryption Key**: Derived from wallet signature using HKDF, never stored on any server 2. **Data at Rest**: AES-256-GCM encrypted on Walrus, only user can decrypt 3. **Access Control**: On-chain authorization stored in user's vault, instant revocation 4. **Processing**: Stateless serverless functions, no database, no logs, no persistence 5. **API Keys**: User-provided, stored only in browser localStorage --- ## License MIT License --- ## Links -
