input.content: # MindVault [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: - Your thought patterns - Your business secrets - Your personal struggles - Your creative ideas - Your private conversations All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model. **This should terrify any rational person.** We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. --- ## The Web3 Alternative Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. What if your AI conversations were: - **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you - **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data - **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default - **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs This is what MindVault is building. --- ## What MindVault Does Today MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. ### Core Features **Client-Side Encryption** - All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser - Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt - The key never leaves your device **Decentralized Storage** - Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network - Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain - You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime **Persistent Memory** - Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus - AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) - Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key **Cryptographic Proofs** - Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time - On-chain timestamps cannot be forged - Anyone can verify without seeing the content **Bring Your Own API** - Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) - Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it - If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** --- ## The Privacy Spectrum MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: | Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | |-------|-----------------|-------------------| | MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext | | MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | | MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | **The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. --- ## What We're Building Toward Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: - AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) - Even we cannot see your data - Payment is in crypto, no identity required - The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable **Why can't we do this today?** Technical limitations: - TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental - Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead - The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. --- ## Architecture ``` Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file: 1â†’# MindVault 2â†’ 3â†’[English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) 4â†’ 5â†’--- 6â†’ 7â†’ 8â†’ 9â†’## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain 10â†’ 11â†’Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: 12â†’ 13â†’- Your thought patterns 14â†’- Your business secrets 15â†’- Your personal struggles 16â†’- Your creative ideas 17â†’- Your private conversations 18â†’ 19â†’All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model. 20â†’ 21â†’**This should terrify any rational person.** 22â†’ 23â†’We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. 24â†’ 25â†’--- 26â†’ 27â†’## The Web3 Alternative 28â†’ 29â†’Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. 30â†’ 31â†’What if your AI conversations were: 32â†’- **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you 33â†’- **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data 34â†’- **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default 35â†’- **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs 36â†’ 37â†’This is what MindVault is building. 38â†’ 39â†’--- 40â†’ 41â†’## What MindVault Does Today 42â†’ 43â†’MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. 44â†’ 45â†’### Core Features 46â†’ 47â†’**Client-Side Encryption** 48â†’- All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser 49â†’- Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt 50â†’- The key never leaves your device 51â†’ 52â†’**Decentralized Storage** 53â†’- Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network 54â†’- Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain 55â†’- You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime 56â†’ 57â†’**Persistent Memory** 58â†’- Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus 59â†’- AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) 60â†’- Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key 61â†’ 62â†’**Cryptographic Proofs** 63â†’- Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time 64â†’- On-chain timestamps cannot be forged 65â†’- Anyone can verify without seeing the content 66â†’ 67â†’**Bring Your Own API** 68â†’- Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) 69â†’- Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it 70â†’- If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** 71â†’ 72â†’--- 73â†’ 74â†’## The Privacy Spectrum 75â†’ 76â†’MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: 77â†’ 78â†’| Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | 79â†’|-------|-----------------|-------------------| 80â†’| MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext | 81â†’| MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | 82â†’| MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | 83â†’ 84â†’**The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. 85â†’ 86â†’--- 87â†’ 88â†’## What We're Building Toward 89â†’ 90â†’Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: 91â†’ 92â†’- AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) 93â†’- Even we cannot see your data 94â†’- Payment is in crypto, no identity required 95â†’- The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable 96â†’ 97â†’**Why can't we do this today?** 98â†’ 99â†’Technical limitations: 100â†’- TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental 101â†’- Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead 102â†’- The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature 103â†’ 104â†’But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. 105â†’ 106â†’--- 107â†’ 108â†’## Architecture 109â†’ 110â†’``` toolUseResult.content: # MindVault [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: - Your thought patterns - Your business secrets - Your personal struggles - Your creative ideas - Your private conversations All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model. **This should terrify any rational person.** We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. --- ## The Web3 Alternative Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. What if your AI conversations were: - **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you - **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data - **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default - **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs This is what MindVault is building. --- ## What MindVault Does Today MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. ### Core Features **Client-Side Encryption** - All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser - Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt - The key never leaves your device **Decentralized Storage** - Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network - Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain - You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime **Persistent Memory** - Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus - AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) - Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key **Cryptographic Proofs** - Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time - On-chain timestamps cannot be forged - Anyone can verify without seeing the content **Bring Your Own API** - Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) - Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it - If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** --- ## The Privacy Spectrum MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: | Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | |-------|-----------------|-------------------| | MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext | | MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | | MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | **The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. --- ## What We're Building Toward Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: - AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) - Even we cannot see your data - Payment is in crypto, no identity required - The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable **Why can't we do this today?** Technical limitations: - TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental - Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead - The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. --- ## Architecture ``` â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ DataVault (your object) â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ Receive decrypted message â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ Blob references â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ Call LLM API â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€ Access permissions â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€ Return +## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain
+Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over:
-When we use ChatGPT, Claude, or other AI services, there's an uncomfortable reality:
-- Your conversation history is stored on the provider's servers
-- You don't know who can access your data, or if it's used for training
-- You can't truly delete or migrate your data
-MindVault was built to answer one question: **Who should own AI conversation data?**

+All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model.
+We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time.
-We believe in transparency. Here's exactly what MindVault can and cannot do:
-- Encrypt your conversations before storage - the platform never sees plaintext
-- Store data on decentralized infrastructure you control (Walrus)
-- Manage access permissions on-chain with instant revocation (Sui)
-- Process AI requests statelessly - no server-side data retention
-- Let you export, delete, or migrate your data freely
-- Hide your messages from the AI provider during inference - they need to see plaintext to process it
-- This is a fundamental limitation of current LLM technology, not something we can bypass
+Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**.
+- **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you
+- **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data
+- **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default
+- **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs
-- **TEE (Trusted Execution Environment)**: Run AI inference in hardware-secured enclaves where even operators can't see your data
-- **Local Models**: Support running open-source models locally so your data never leaves your device
-MindVault aims to become **privacy AI infrastructure**, progressively achieving true end-to-end privacy as technology evolves.
+MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage.
-Alex is a freelancer who uses AI assistants to:

-But Alex has a concern: these conversations contain client-sensitive information, business ideas, and even private thoughts. Alex doesn't know how long the data is stored, if it's used for training, or who might access it.
+- All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser
+- Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt
+- The key never leaves your device
+- Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network
+- Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain
+- You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime
+- Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus
+- AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission)
+- Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key
-1. **Connect Wallet**: Alex logs in with a Sui wallet - no registration needed
-2. **Encrypted Storage**: Every message is encrypted in the browser before being stored
-3. **Keys in Your Hands**: The encryption key is derived from Alex's wallet signature - only Alex can decrypt
-4. **Full Control**: Alex can delete any conversation instantly, without "requesting" deletion
-5. **Fully Portable**: If a better service comes along, Alex can export all data and take it
+- Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time
+- Anyone can verify without seeing the content

-Alex can finally discuss sensitive topics with AI confidently - not because the AI can't see it (it still does during inference), but because the data is **completely under Alex's control** and won't persist on some unknown server forever.
+- Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.)
+- Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it
+- If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous**
-| Wallet Connection | Live | Sui Wallet, Suiet, and more |
-| Client-Side Encryption | Live | AES-256-GCM, key derived from wallet signature |
-| Decentralized Storage | Live | Walrus testnet integration |
-| On-Chain Access Control | Live | Sui smart contract for permissions |
-| Instant Revocation | Live | User can unilaterally revoke any authorization |
-| Custom AI Providers | Live | Bring your own API key (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, etc.) |
-| Stateless Processing | Live | API layer never persists any data |
-| **Chat History Loading** | **Live** | **Load and decrypt past conversations from Walrus** |
-| **Proof Verification** | **Live** | **Generate and verify conversation authenticity proofs** |
-| Local Models | Planned | WebLLM / Ollama support |
-| TEE Inference | Research | Hardware-secured AI processing |
+MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup:
+| MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext |
+| MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding |
+| MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device |
+**The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**.
-MindVault now supports **conversation proofs** - cryptographic evidence that a conversation was stored on-chain at a specific time.
-- **Authenticity**: Prove a conversation happened at a specific time
-- **Verifiable**: Anyone can verify without seeing the content
-- **Portable**: Export and share proofs as JSON files
+Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where:
+- AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE)
+- Even we cannot see your data
+- Payment is in crypto, no identity required
+- The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable
-1. **Export a Proof**: Click the "Proof" button on any encrypted message
-2. **Verify a Proof**: Go to `/verify` and paste the proof JSON
-3. **Share**: Send the proof file to anyone who needs to verify
+- TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental
+- Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead
+- The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature
+But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step.

-**Q: How do I update the deployed contract address?**

-- **Owned Objects**: DataVault is owned by the user, ensuring 100% control
-- **Dynamic Fields**: Authorization and blob references stored as dynamic fields
-- **Instant Revocation**: Users can revoke access anytime since auth data lives in their vault

toolUseResult.originalFile: # MindVault > **Your Data, Your Rules.** | **ä½ çš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œä½ åšä¸»ã€‚** AI conversations you truly own. Client-side encryption, decentralized storage, and blockchain-based access control on Sui. [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Author's Philosophy ### Why MindVault? When we use ChatGPT, Claude, or other AI services, there's an uncomfortable reality: - Your conversation history is stored on the provider's servers - You don't know who can access your data, or if it's used for training - You can't truly delete or migrate your data MindVault was built to answer one question: **Who should own AI conversation data?** Our answer: **The user.** ### An Honest Disclosure We believe in transparency. Here's exactly what MindVault can and cannot do: **What We Can Do:** - Encrypt your conversations before storage - the platform never sees plaintext - Store data on decentralized infrastructure you control (Walrus) - Manage access permissions on-chain with instant revocation (Sui) - Process AI requests statelessly - no server-side data retention - Let you export, delete, or migrate your data freely **What We Cannot Do (Yet):** - Hide your messages from the AI provider during inference - they need to see plaintext to process it - This is a fundamental limitation of current LLM technology, not something we can bypass ### Future Direction We're researching next-generation privacy AI technologies: - **TEE (Trusted Execution Environment)**: Run AI inference in hardware-secured enclaves where even operators can't see your data - **Local Models**: Support running open-source models locally so your data never leaves your device MindVault aims to become **privacy AI infrastructure**, progressively achieving true end-to-end privacy as technology evolves. --- ## User Story ### The Problem Alex is a freelancer who uses AI assistants to: - Organize client requirements - Draft contracts and emails - Brainstorm product ideas But Alex has a concern: these conversations contain client-sensitive information, business ideas, and even private thoughts. Alex doesn't know how long the data is stored, if it's used for training, or who might access it. ### The MindVault Solution With MindVault: 1. **Connect Wallet**: Alex logs in with a Sui wallet - no registration needed 2. **Encrypted Storage**: Every message is encrypted in the browser before being stored 3. **Keys in Your Hands**: The encryption key is derived from Alex's wallet signature - only Alex can decrypt 4. **Full Control**: Alex can delete any conversation instantly, without "requesting" deletion 5. **Fully Portable**: If a better service comes along, Alex can export all data and take it Alex can finally discuss sensitive topics with AI confidently - not because the AI can't see it (it still does during inference), but because the data is **completely under Alex's control** and won't persist on some unknown server forever. --- ## Current Features | Feature | Status | Description | |---------|--------|-------------| | Wallet Connection | Live | Sui Wallet, Suiet, and more | | Client-Side Encryption | Live | AES-256-GCM, key derived from wallet signature | | Decentralized Storage | Live | Walrus testnet integration | | On-Chain Access Control | Live | Sui smart contract for permissions | | Instant Revocation | Live | User can unilaterally revoke any authorization | | Custom AI Providers | Live | Bring your own API key (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, etc.) | | Stateless Processing | Live | API layer never persists any data | | **Chat History Loading** | **Live** | **Load and decrypt past conversations from Walrus** | | **Proof Verification** | **Live** | **Generate and verify conversation authenticity proofs** | | Local Models | Planned | WebLLM / Ollama support | | TEE Inference | Research | Hardware-secured AI processing | --- ## New: Conversation Proofs MindVault now supports **conversation proofs** - cryptographic evidence that a conversation was stored on-chain at a specific time. ### Why Proofs Matter - **Authenticity**: Prove a conversation happened at a specific time - **Tamper-proof**: On-chain timestamps cannot be forged - **Verifiable**: Anyone can verify without seeing the content - **Portable**: Export and share proofs as JSON files ### How to Use 1. **Export a Proof**: Click the "Proof" button on any encrypted message 2. **Verify a Proof**: Go to `/verify` and paste the proof JSON 3. **Share**: Send the proof file to anyone who needs to verify ### What's Verified - Vault exists on Sui blockchain - Blob exists on Walrus storage - Timestamp is valid - Transaction (if provided) matches the proof --- ## Architecture ### Dual-Layer Privacy Model ``` (optional, for contract deployment) - Sui Wallet (Sui Wallet, Suiet, etc.) ### 1. Clone the Repository ```bash git clone https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui.git cd MindVault-VibeSui ``` ### 2. Setup Frontend ```bash cd frontend npm install cp .env.example .env.local ``` Edit `.env.local`: ```env NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID=0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6 ``` ### 3. Run Development Server ```bash npm run dev ``` Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) in your browser. ### 4. Configure AI Provider 1. Connect your Sui wallet 2. Go to **Settings** page 3. Configure your AI provider (baseURL, API key, model) 4. Start chatting! --- ## Vercel Deployment ### One-Click Deploy [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) ### Manual Deployment Steps 1. Fork this repository to your GitHub account 2. Create a new project in Vercel - Click "Add New" â†’ "Project" - Select your forked repository 3. **Important Configuration**: - **Root Directory**: `frontend` - **Framework Preset**: `Next.js` - **Build Command**: `npm run build` - **Output Directory**: `.next` 4. Set environment variables: | Variable | Value | Required | |----------|-------|----------| | `NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID` | `0xd8e2b3...` | Yes | 5. Click Deploy ### Custom AI Provider Configuration MindVault supports user-configured AI providers in the Settings page - no code changes needed: ``` Settings â†’ AI Provider Configuration â”œâ”€â”€ API Base URL: https://api.openai.com/v1 (or any compatible endpoint) â”œâ”€â”€ API Key: sk-xxx... (stored in browser localStorage only) â””â”€â”€ Model: gpt-4o / claude-sonnet-4-20250514 / deepseek-chat / ... ``` **Supported Compatible Endpoints:** - OpenAI API - Anthropic Claude API - Azure OpenAI - DeepSeek - Moonshot - Any OpenAI-compatible API (e.g., local Ollama) ### FAQ **Q: Deployment fails with "No Next.js version detected"** A: Make sure Root Directory is set to `frontend`, not the project root. **Q: How do I update the deployed contract address?** A: Go to Vercel project settings â†’ Environment Variables, modify `NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID`, then redeploy. **Q: Do I need server-side API keys?** A: No. Users configure their own API keys in the browser. The keys are stored in localStorage and never sent to our servers for storage. --- ## Smart Contract The `DataVault` contract uses Sui's native features for maximum user control: ### Core Design - **Owned Objects**: DataVault is owned by the user, ensuring 100% control - **Dynamic Fields**: Authorization and blob references stored as dynamic fields - **Instant Revocation**: Users can revoke access anytime since auth data lives in their vault ### Key Functions ```move // Create a new vault public entry fun create_vault(clock: &Clock, ctx: &mut TxContext) // Store encrypted blob reference public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, blob_type: u8, iv: vector, ...) // Grant access to a provider (stores auth in user's vault) public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, scope: u8, expires_at: u64, ...) // Revoke access (user can always do this unilaterally) public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) // Check if provider is authorized (view function) public fun is_authorized(vault: &DataVault, provider: address, clock: &Clock): bool ``` ### Deployed Contract (Testnet) - **Package ID**: `0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6` - **Transaction**: `AdH8tBSVJ87FRG8tPuG2NDSUtX9F4ExBwZ9SuDt5Q4M6` ### Deploy Your Own ```bash cd contracts/data_vault sui client publish --gas-budget 100000000 ``` --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Technology | |-------|------------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS | | Blockchain | Sui, Move 2024 | | Storage | Walrus | | AI | Any OpenAI-compatible API | | Deployment | Vercel | --- ## Project Structure ``` MindVault-VibeSui/ â”œâ”€â”€ contracts/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ data_vault/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ Move.toml â”‚ â””â”€â”€ sources/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ data_vault.move # Sui smart contract â”œâ”€â”€ frontend/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ src/ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ app/ # Next.js pages â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ api/chat/ # AI chat API route â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ chat/ # Chat page â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ dashboard/ # Dashboard page â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ settings/ # Settings page â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ components/ # React components â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ hooks/ # Custom hooks â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ lib/ # Utilities (encryption, sui, walrus) â”‚ â””â”€â”€ package.json â”œâ”€â”€ README.md â””â”€â”€ AI_DISCLOSURE.md ``` --- ## Security Model 1. **Encryption Key**: Derived from wallet signature using HKDF, never stored on any server 2. **Data at Rest**: AES-256-GCM encrypted on Walrus, only user can decrypt 3. **Access Control**: On-chain authorization stored in user's vault, instant revocation 4. **Processing**: Stateless serverless functions, no database, no logs, no persistence 5. **API Keys**: User-provided, stored only in browser localStorage --- ## License MIT License --- ## Links - content.content: 1â†’# MindVault 2â†’ 3â†’[English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) 4â†’ 5â†’--- 6â†’ 7â†’ 8â†’ 9â†’## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain 10â†’ 11â†’Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: 12â†’ 13â†’- Your thought patterns 14â†’- Your business secrets 15â†’- Your personal struggles 16â†’- Your creative ideas 17â†’- Your private conversations 18â†’ 19â†’All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model. 20â†’ 21â†’**This should terrify any rational person.** 22â†’ 23â†’We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. 24â†’ 25â†’--- 26â†’ 27â†’## The Web3 Alternative 28â†’ 29â†’Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. 30â†’ 31â†’What if your AI conversations were: 32â†’- **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you 33â†’- **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data 34â†’- **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default 35â†’- **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs 36â†’ 37â†’This is what MindVault is building. 38â†’ 39â†’--- 40â†’ 41â†’## What MindVault Does Today 42â†’ 43â†’MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. 44â†’ 45â†’### Core Features 46â†’ 47â†’**Client-Side Encryption** 48â†’- All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser 49â†’- Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt 50â†’- The key never leaves your device 51â†’ 52â†’**Decentralized Storage** 53â†’- Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network 54â†’- Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain 55â†’- You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime 56â†’ 57â†’**Persistent Memory** 58â†’- Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus 59â†’- AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) 60â†’- Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key 61â†’ 62â†’**Cryptographic Proofs** 63â†’- Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time 64â†’- On-chain timestamps cannot be forged 65â†’- Anyone can verify without seeing the content 66â†’ 67â†’**Bring Your Own API** 68â†’- Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) 69â†’- Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it 70â†’- If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** 71â†’ 72â†’--- 73â†’ 74â†’## The Privacy Spectrum 75â†’ 76â†’MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: 77â†’ 78â†’| Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | 79â†’|-------|-----------------|-------------------| 80â†’| MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext | 81â†’| MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | 82â†’| MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | 83â†’ 84â†’**The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. 85â†’ 86â†’--- 87â†’ 88â†’## What We're Building Toward 89â†’ 90â†’Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: 91â†’ 92â†’- AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) 93â†’- Even we cannot see your data 94â†’- Payment is in crypto, no identity required 95â†’- The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable 96â†’ 97â†’**Why can't we do this today?** 98â†’ 99â†’Technical limitations: 100â†’- TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental 101â†’- Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead 102â†’- The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature 103â†’ 104â†’But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. 105â†’ 106â†’--- 107â†’ 108â†’## Architecture 109â†’ 110â†’``` file.content: # MindVault [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: - Your thought patterns - Your business secrets - Your personal struggles - Your creative ideas - Your private conversations All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model. **This should terrify any rational person.** We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. --- ## The Web3 Alternative Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. What if your AI conversations were: - **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you - **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data - **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default - **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs This is what MindVault is building. --- ## What MindVault Does Today MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. ### Core Features **Client-Side Encryption** - All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser - Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt - The key never leaves your device **Decentralized Storage** - Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network - Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain - You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime **Persistent Memory** - Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus - AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) - Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key **Cryptographic Proofs** - Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time - On-chain timestamps cannot be forged - Anyone can verify without seeing the content **Bring Your Own API** - Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) - Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it - If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** --- ## The Privacy Spectrum MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: | Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | |-------|-----------------|-------------------| | MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext | | MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | | MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | **The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. --- ## What We're Building Toward Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: - AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) - Even we cannot see your data - Payment is in crypto, no identity required - The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable **Why can't we do this today?** Technical limitations: - TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental - Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead - The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. --- ## Architecture ``` â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ DataVault (your object) â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ Receive decrypted message â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ Blob references â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ Call LLM API â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€ Access permissions â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€ Return response (no storage) â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ Walrus Storage â”‚ â”‚ âš ï¸ Stateless: memory released after â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€ AES-256 encrypted blobs â”‚ â”‚ each request, nothing persisted â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ ğŸ“Œ You own this. 100%. â”‚ â”‚ ğŸ“Œ We see plaintext briefly, but we â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ don't store it. Use anonymous API â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ for full privacy. â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` --- ## Quick Start ### Prerequisites - Node.js 18+ - Sui Wallet (Sui Wallet, Suiet, etc.) ### 1. Clone & Install ```bash git clone https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui.git cd MindVault-VibeSui/frontend npm install ``` ### 2. Configure ```bash cp .env.example .env.local ``` Edit `.env.local`: ```env NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID=0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6 ``` ### 3. Run ```bash npm run dev ``` Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) ### 4. Use 1. Connect your Sui wallet 2. Go to Settings â†’ Configure your AI provider 3. Start chatting â€” your messages are encrypted and stored on-chain --- ## Deploy Your Own [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) **Important**: Set Root Directory to `frontend` --- ## Smart Contract The `DataVault` contract on Sui gives you **protocol-level ownership**: ```move // Your vault â€” only you can modify it public struct DataVault has key, store { id: UID, blob_count: u64, created_at: u64, // Authorizations stored as dynamic fields } // Store encrypted blob reference public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, ...) // Grant/revoke access â€” you're always in control public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) ``` **Deployed on Testnet**: `0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6` --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Technology | |-------|------------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS | | Blockchain | Sui (Move 2024) | | Storage | Walrus | | Encryption | AES-256-GCM, HKDF | | AI | Any OpenAI-compatible API | --- ## License MIT --- ## Links - [Live Demo](https://mind-vault-vibe-sui.vercel.app) - [GitHub](https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui) - [Sui Docs](https://docs.sui.io/) - [Walrus Docs](https://docs.walrus.site/) --- # MindVault ## input.content: # MindVault [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: - Your thought patterns - Your business secrets - Your personal struggles - Your creative ideas - Your private conversations All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model, or to build advertising algorithms specifically targeting you. Your identity and your mind are being harvested and exploited. **This should terrify any rational person.** We are building the most detailed thought vaults in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. --- ## The Web3 Alternative Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. What if your AI conversations were: - **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you - **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data - **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default - **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs This is what MindVault is building. --- ## User Stories ### Story 1: The Profile Breaker **The Problem with Today's AI Services** When you chat with ChatGPT's web interface, OpenAI holds three things: 1. **Your real identity** (email/phone/credit card) 2. **Your current intent** (what you're asking right now) 3. **Your complete history** (everything you've asked over the past year â€” building a profile of your personality, profession, and vulnerabilities) This is the perfect recipe for a psychological profile. Even if a single conversation leaks, the damage is limited. But when your entire thought history is tied to your identity, you become completely transparent to whoever holds that data. **How MindVault Breaks the Chain** With MindVault, you fragment this data monopoly: - **Identity**: Your wallet address, not your email. Pseudonymous by default. - **Current conversation**: Sent to the AI provider, yes â€” but if you use an anonymous API relay, they can't link it to you. - **History**: Encrypted and stored on Walrus. Only you can decrypt it. The AI provider never sees your past. The result? Even if data leaks, it's **fragmented, encrypted, and unlinked**. A broken profile is infinitely better than a complete one. --- ### Story 2: The Timestamp Witness **The Problem with Proving "I Thought of It First"** Screenshots can be faked. Server logs can be tampered with by admins. If you claim "I came up with this idea on January 1st, 2026," it's nearly impossible to prove. **How MindVault Creates Immutable Proof** When you have a critical conversation â€” brainstorming a business plan, getting legal advice, documenting a creative idea â€” MindVault anchors it to the blockchain: 1. **The conversation is encrypted** and stored on Walrus 2. **A transaction is recorded on Sui** containing the hash of the encrypted data and a precise timestamp 3. **The blockchain timestamp cannot be forged** â€” it's consensus-verified by the network Three months later, when there's a copyright dispute or you need to prove prior art: - Export the cryptographic proof from MindVault - Anyone can verify: "This encrypted blob existed at this exact time" - You can optionally reveal the content to prove what was inside **Zero-knowledge verification**: Prove the existence and timing without revealing the content. --- ## What MindVault Does Today MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. ### Core Features **Client-Side Encryption** - All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser - Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt - The key never leaves your device **Decentralized Storage** - Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network - Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain - You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime **Persistent Memory** - Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus - AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) - Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key **Cryptographic Proofs** - Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time - On-chain timestamps cannot be forged - Anyone can verify without seeing the content **Bring Your Own API** - Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) - Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it - If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** --- ## The Privacy Spectrum MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: | Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | |-------|-----------------|-------------------| | MindVault + OpenAI (or other providers) | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ Provider sees plaintext | | MindVault + Anonymous API (e.g., identity-free relay) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | | MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | **The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. --- ## What We're Building Toward What we (or rather, the author) really want to build is a fully cryptographic API service. But we can't do it yet. Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: - AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) - Even we cannot see your data - Payment is in crypto, no identity required - The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable **Why can't we do this today?** Technical limitations: - TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental - Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead - The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. --- ## Architecture ``` store { id: UID, blob_count: u64, created_at: u64, // Authorizations stored as dynamic fields } // Store encrypted blob reference public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, ...) // Grant/revoke access â€” you're always in control public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) ``` **Deployed on Testnet**: `0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6` --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Technology | |-------|------------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file: 1â†’# MindVault 2â†’ 3â†’[English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) 4â†’ 5â†’--- 6â†’ 7â†’ 8â†’ 9â†’## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain 10â†’ 11â†’Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: 12â†’ 13â†’- Your thought patterns 14â†’- Your business secrets 15â†’- Your personal struggles 16â†’- Your creative ideas 17â†’- Your private conversations 18â†’ 19â†’All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model, or to build advertising algorithms specifically targeting you. 20â†’ 21â†’Your identity and your mind are being harvested and exploited. 22â†’ 23â†’**This should terrify any rational person.** 24â†’ 25â†’We are building the most detailed thought vaults in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. 26â†’ 27â†’--- 28â†’ 29â†’## The Web3 Alternative 30â†’ 31â†’Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. 32â†’ 33â†’What if your AI conversations were: 34â†’- **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you 35â†’- **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data 36â†’- **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default 37â†’- **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs 38â†’ 39â†’This is what MindVault is building. 40â†’ 41â†’--- 42â†’ 43â†’## User Stories 44â†’ 45â†’### Story 1: The Profile Breaker 46â†’ 47â†’**The Problem with Today's AI Services** 48â†’ 49â†’When you chat with ChatGPT's web interface, OpenAI holds three things: 50â†’ 51â†’1. **Your real identity** (email/phone/credit card) 52â†’2. **Your current intent** (what you're asking right now) 53â†’3. **Your complete history** (everything you've asked over the past year â€” building a profile of your personality, profession, and vulnerabilities) 54â†’ 55â†’This is the perfect recipe for a psychological profile. Even if a single conversation leaks, the damage is limited. But when your entire thought history is tied to your identity, you become completely transparent to whoever holds that data. 56â†’ 57â†’**How MindVault Breaks the Chain** 58â†’ 59â†’With MindVault, you fragment this data monopoly: 60â†’ 61â†’- **Identity**: Your wallet address, not your email. Pseudonymous by default. 62â†’- **Current conversation**: Sent to the AI provider, yes â€” but if you use an anonymous API relay, they can't link it to you. 63â†’- **History**: Encrypted and stored on Walrus. Only you can decrypt it. The AI provider never sees your past. 64â†’ 65â†’The result? Even if data leaks, it's **fragmented, encrypted, and unlinked**. A broken profile is infinitely better than a complete one. 66â†’ 67â†’--- 68â†’ 69â†’### Story 2: The Timestamp Witness 70â†’ 71â†’**The Problem with Proving "I Thought of It First"** 72â†’ 73â†’Screenshots can be faked. Server logs can be tampered with by admins. If you claim "I came up with this idea on January 1st, 2026," it's nearly impossible to prove. 74â†’ 75â†’**How MindVault Creates Immutable Proof** 76â†’ 77â†’When you have a critical conversation â€” brainstorming a business plan, getting legal advice, documenting a creative idea â€” MindVault anchors it to the blockchain: 78â†’ 79â†’1. **The conversation is encrypted** and stored on Walrus 80â†’2. **A transaction is recorded on Sui** containing the hash of the encrypted data and a precise timestamp 81â†’3. **The blockchain timestamp cannot be forged** â€” it's consensus-verified by the network 82â†’ 83â†’Three months later, when there's a copyright dispute or you need to prove prior art: 84â†’ 85â†’- Export the cryptographic proof from MindVault 86â†’- Anyone can verify: "This encrypted blob existed at this exact time" 87â†’- You can optionally reveal the content to prove what was inside 88â†’ 89â†’**Zero-knowledge verification**: Prove the existence and timing without revealing the content. 90â†’ 91â†’--- 92â†’ 93â†’## What MindVault Does Today 94â†’ 95â†’MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. 96â†’ 97â†’### Core Features 98â†’ 99â†’**Client-Side Encryption** 100â†’- All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser 101â†’- Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt 102â†’- The key never leaves your device 103â†’ 104â†’**Decentralized Storage** 105â†’- Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network 106â†’- Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain 107â†’- You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime 108â†’ 109â†’**Persistent Memory** 110â†’- Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus 111â†’- AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) 112â†’- Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key 113â†’ 114â†’**Cryptographic Proofs** 115â†’- Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time 116â†’- On-chain timestamps cannot be forged 117â†’- Anyone can verify without seeing the content 118â†’ 119â†’**Bring Your Own API** 120â†’- Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) 121â†’- Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it 122â†’- If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** 123â†’ 124â†’--- 125â†’ 126â†’## The Privacy Spectrum 127â†’ 128â†’MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: 129â†’ 130â†’| Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | 131â†’|-------|-----------------|-------------------| 132â†’| MindVault + OpenAI (or other providers) | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ Provider sees plaintext | 133â†’| MindVault + Anonymous API (e.g., identity-free relay) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | 134â†’| MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | 135â†’ 136â†’**The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. 137â†’ 138â†’--- 139â†’ 140â†’## What We're Building Toward 141â†’ 142â†’What we (or rather, the author) really want to build is a fully cryptographic API service. But we can't do it yet. 143â†’ 144â†’Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: 145â†’ 146â†’- AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) 147â†’- Even we cannot see your data 148â†’- Payment is in crypto, no identity required 149â†’- The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable 150â†’ 151â†’**Why can't we do this today?** 152â†’ 153â†’Technical limitations: 154â†’- TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental 155â†’- Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead 156â†’- The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature 157â†’ 158â†’But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. 159â†’ 160â†’--- 161â†’ 162â†’## Architecture 163â†’ 164â†’``` toolUseResult.content: # MindVault [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: - Your thought patterns - Your business secrets - Your personal struggles - Your creative ideas - Your private conversations All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model, or to build advertising algorithms specifically targeting you. Your identity and your mind are being harvested and exploited. **This should terrify any rational person.** We are building the most detailed thought vaults in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. --- ## The Web3 Alternative Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. What if your AI conversations were: - **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you - **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data - **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default - **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs This is what MindVault is building. --- ## User Stories ### Story 1: The Profile Breaker **The Problem with Today's AI Services** When you chat with ChatGPT's web interface, OpenAI holds three things: 1. **Your real identity** (email/phone/credit card) 2. **Your current intent** (what you're asking right now) 3. **Your complete history** (everything you've asked over the past year â€” building a profile of your personality, profession, and vulnerabilities) This is the perfect recipe for a psychological profile. Even if a single conversation leaks, the damage is limited. But when your entire thought history is tied to your identity, you become completely transparent to whoever holds that data. **How MindVault Breaks the Chain** With MindVault, you fragment this data monopoly: - **Identity**: Your wallet address, not your email. Pseudonymous by default. - **Current conversation**: Sent to the AI provider, yes â€” but if you use an anonymous API relay, they can't link it to you. - **History**: Encrypted and stored on Walrus. Only you can decrypt it. The AI provider never sees your past. The result? Even if data leaks, it's **fragmented, encrypted, and unlinked**. A broken profile is infinitely better than a complete one. --- ### Story 2: The Timestamp Witness **The Problem with Proving "I Thought of It First"** Screenshots can be faked. Server logs can be tampered with by admins. If you claim "I came up with this idea on January 1st, 2026," it's nearly impossible to prove. **How MindVault Creates Immutable Proof** When you have a critical conversation â€” brainstorming a business plan, getting legal advice, documenting a creative idea â€” MindVault anchors it to the blockchain: 1. **The conversation is encrypted** and stored on Walrus 2. **A transaction is recorded on Sui** containing the hash of the encrypted data and a precise timestamp 3. **The blockchain timestamp cannot be forged** â€” it's consensus-verified by the network Three months later, when there's a copyright dispute or you need to prove prior art: - Export the cryptographic proof from MindVault - Anyone can verify: "This encrypted blob existed at this exact time" - You can optionally reveal the content to prove what was inside **Zero-knowledge verification**: Prove the existence and timing without revealing the content. --- ## What MindVault Does Today MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. ### Core Features **Client-Side Encryption** - All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser - Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt - The key never leaves your device **Decentralized Storage** - Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network - Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain - You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime **Persistent Memory** - Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus - AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) - Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key **Cryptographic Proofs** - Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time - On-chain timestamps cannot be forged - Anyone can verify without seeing the content **Bring Your Own API** - Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) - Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it - If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** --- ## The Privacy Spectrum MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: | Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | |-------|-----------------|-------------------| | MindVault + OpenAI (or other providers) | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ Provider sees plaintext | | MindVault + Anonymous API (e.g., identity-free relay) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | | MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | **The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. --- ## What We're Building Toward What we (or rather, the author) really want to build is a fully cryptographic API service. But we can't do it yet. Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: - AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) - Even we cannot see your data - Payment is in crypto, no identity required - The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable **Why can't we do this today?** Technical limitations: - TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental - Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead - The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. --- ## Architecture ``` Directory to `frontend` --- ## Smart Contract The `DataVault` contract on Sui gives you **protocol-level ownership**: ```move // Your vault â€” only you can modify it public struct DataVault has key, store { id: UID, blob_count: u64, created_at: u64, // Authorizations stored as dynamic fields } // Store encrypted blob reference public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, ...) // Grant/revoke access â€” you're always in control public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) ``` **Deployed on Testnet**: `0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6` --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Technology | |-------|------------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, lines: -All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model.

+All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model, or to build advertising algorithms specifically targeting you.
+Your identity and your mind are being harvested and exploited.
-We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time.
+We are building the most detailed thought vaults in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time.
+When you chat with ChatGPT's web interface, OpenAI holds three things:
+2. **Your current intent** (what you're asking right now)
+3. **Your complete history** (everything you've asked over the past year â€” building a profile of your personality, profession, and vulnerabilities)

+This is the perfect recipe for a psychological profile. Even if a single conversation leaks, the damage is limited. But when your entire thought history is tied to your identity, you become completely transparent to whoever holds that data.
+With MindVault, you fragment this data monopoly:
+- **Identity**: Your wallet address, not your email. Pseudonymous by default.
+- **Current conversation**: Sent to the AI provider, yes â€” but if you use an anonymous API relay, they can't link it to you.
+- **History**: Encrypted and stored on Walrus. Only you can decrypt it. The AI provider never sees your past.
+The result? Even if data leaks, it's **fragmented, encrypted, and unlinked**. A broken profile is infinitely better than a complete one.
+**The Problem with Proving "I Thought of It First"**
+Screenshots can be faked. Server logs can be tampered with by admins. If you claim "I came up with this idea on January 1st, 2026," it's nearly impossible to prove.
+When you have a critical conversation â€” brainstorming a business plan, getting legal advice, documenting a creative idea â€” MindVault anchors it to the blockchain:
+1. **The conversation is encrypted** and stored on Walrus
+2. **A transaction is recorded on Sui** containing the hash of the encrypted data and a precise timestamp
+3. **The blockchain timestamp cannot be forged** â€” it's consensus-verified by the network
+Three months later, when there's a copyright dispute or you need to prove prior art:
+- Export the cryptographic proof from MindVault
+- Anyone can verify: "This encrypted blob existed at this exact time"
+- You can optionally reveal the content to prove what was inside
+**Zero-knowledge verification**: Prove the existence and timing without revealing the content.
MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage.
-| MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext |
-| MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding |
+| MindVault + OpenAI (or other providers) | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ Provider sees plaintext |
+| MindVault + Anonymous API (e.g., identity-free relay) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding |
| MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device |
**The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**.
+What we (or rather, the author) really want to build is a fully cryptographic API service. But we can't do it yet.
Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where:
- AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE)

toolUseResult.originalFile: # MindVault [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: - Your thought patterns - Your business secrets - Your personal struggles - Your creative ideas - Your private conversations All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model. **This should terrify any rational person.** We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. --- ## The Web3 Alternative Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. What if your AI conversations were: - **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you - **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data - **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default - **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs This is what MindVault is building. --- ## What MindVault Does Today MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. ### Core Features **Client-Side Encryption** - All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser - Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt - The key never leaves your device **Decentralized Storage** - Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network - Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain - You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime **Persistent Memory** - Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus - AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) - Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key **Cryptographic Proofs** - Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time - On-chain timestamps cannot be forged - Anyone can verify without seeing the content **Bring Your Own API** - Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) - Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it - If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** --- ## The Privacy Spectrum MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: | Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | |-------|-----------------|-------------------| | MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext | | MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | | MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | **The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. --- ## What We're Building Toward Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: - AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) - Even we cannot see your data - Payment is in crypto, no identity required - The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable **Why can't we do this today?** Technical limitations: - TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental - Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead - The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. --- ## Architecture ``` content.content: 1â†’# MindVault 2â†’ 3â†’[English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) 4â†’ 5â†’--- 6â†’ 7â†’ 8â†’ 9â†’## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain 10â†’ 11â†’Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: 12â†’ 13â†’- Your thought patterns 14â†’- Your business secrets 15â†’- Your personal struggles 16â†’- Your creative ideas 17â†’- Your private conversations 18â†’ 19â†’All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model. 20â†’ 21â†’**This should terrify any rational person.** 22â†’ 23â†’We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. 24â†’ 25â†’--- 26â†’ 27â†’## The Web3 Alternative 28â†’ 29â†’Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. 30â†’ 31â†’What if your AI conversations were: 32â†’- **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you 33â†’- **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data 34â†’- **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default 35â†’- **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs 36â†’ 37â†’This is what MindVault is building. 38â†’ 39â†’--- 40â†’ 41â†’## What MindVault Does Today 42â†’ 43â†’MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. 44â†’ 45â†’### Core Features 46â†’ 47â†’**Client-Side Encryption** 48â†’- All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser 49â†’- Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt 50â†’- The key never leaves your device 51â†’ 52â†’**Decentralized Storage** 53â†’- Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network 54â†’- Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain 55â†’- You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime 56â†’ 57â†’**Persistent Memory** 58â†’- Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus 59â†’- AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) 60â†’- Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key 61â†’ 62â†’**Cryptographic Proofs** 63â†’- Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time 64â†’- On-chain timestamps cannot be forged 65â†’- Anyone can verify without seeing the content 66â†’ 67â†’**Bring Your Own API** 68â†’- Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) 69â†’- Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it 70â†’- If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** 71â†’ 72â†’--- 73â†’ 74â†’## The Privacy Spectrum 75â†’ 76â†’MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: 77â†’ 78â†’| Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | 79â†’|-------|-----------------|-------------------| 80â†’| MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext | 81â†’| MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | 82â†’| MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | 83â†’ 84â†’**The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. 85â†’ 86â†’--- 87â†’ 88â†’## What We're Building Toward 89â†’ 90â†’Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: 91â†’ 92â†’- AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) 93â†’- Even we cannot see your data 94â†’- Payment is in crypto, no identity required 95â†’- The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable 96â†’ 97â†’**Why can't we do this today?** 98â†’ 99â†’Technical limitations: 100â†’- TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental 101â†’- Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead 102â†’- The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature 103â†’ 104â†’But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. 105â†’ 106â†’--- 107â†’ 108â†’## Architecture 109â†’ 110â†’``` file.content: # MindVault [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: - Your thought patterns - Your business secrets - Your personal struggles - Your creative ideas - Your private conversations All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model. **This should terrify any rational person.** We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. --- ## The Web3 Alternative Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. What if your AI conversations were: - **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you - **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data - **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default - **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs This is what MindVault is building. --- ## What MindVault Does Today MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. ### Core Features **Client-Side Encryption** - All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser - Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt - The key never leaves your device **Decentralized Storage** - Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network - Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain - You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime **Persistent Memory** - Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus - AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) - Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key **Cryptographic Proofs** - Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time - On-chain timestamps cannot be forged - Anyone can verify without seeing the content **Bring Your Own API** - Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) - Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it - If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** --- ## The Privacy Spectrum MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: | Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | |-------|-----------------|-------------------| | MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext | | MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | | MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | **The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. --- ## What We're Building Toward Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: - AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) - Even we cannot see your data - Payment is in crypto, no identity required - The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable **Why can't we do this today?** Technical limitations: - TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental - Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead - The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. --- ## Architecture ``` HKDF(wallet.sign("mindvault"))â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ (Identity) â”‚ â”‚ (Encryption)â”‚ â”‚ (Only you have this key) â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
