â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ DataVault (your object) â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ Receive decrypted message â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ Blob references â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ Call LLM API â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€ Access permissions â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€ Return response (no storage) â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ Walrus Storage â”‚ â”‚ âš ï¸ Stateless: memory released after â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€ AES-256 encrypted blobs â”‚ â”‚ each request, nothing persisted â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ ğŸ“Œ You own this. 100%. â”‚ â”‚ ğŸ“Œ We see plaintext briefly, but we â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ don't store it. Use anonymous API â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ for full privacy. â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` --- ## Quick Start ### Prerequisites - Node.js 18+ - Sui Wallet (Sui Wallet, Suiet, etc.) ### 1. Clone & Install ```bash git clone https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui.git cd MindVault-VibeSui/frontend npm install ``` ### 2. Configure ```bash cp .env.example .env.local ``` Edit `.env.local`: ```env NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID=0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6 ``` ### 3. Run ```bash npm run dev ``` Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) ### 4. Use 1. Connect your Sui wallet 2. Go to Settings â†’ Configure your AI provider 3. Start chatting â€” your messages are encrypted and stored on-chain --- ## Deploy Your Own [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) **Important**: Set Root Directory to `frontend` --- ## Smart Contract The `DataVault` contract on Sui gives you **protocol-level ownership**: ```move // Your vault â€” only you can modify it public struct DataVault has key, store { id: UID, blob_count: u64, created_at: u64, // Authorizations stored as dynamic fields } // Store encrypted blob reference public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, ...) // Grant/revoke access â€” you're always in control public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) ``` **Deployed on Testnet**: `0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6` --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Technology | |-------|------------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS | | Blockchain | Sui (Move 2024) | | Storage | Walrus | | Encryption | AES-256-GCM, HKDF | | AI | Any OpenAI-compatible API | --- ## License MIT --- ## Links - input.content: # MindVault [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: - Your thought patterns - Your business secrets - Your personal struggles - Your creative ideas - Your private conversations All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model. **This should terrify any rational person.** We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. --- ## The Web3 Alternative Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. What if your AI conversations were: - **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you - **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data - **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default - **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs This is what MindVault is building. --- ## User Stories ### Story 1: The Profile Breaker **The Problem with Today's AI Services** When you chat with ChatGPT's web interface, OpenAI holds three things: 1. **Your real identity** (email/phone/credit card) 2. **Your current intent** (what you're asking right now) 3. **Your complete history** (everything you've asked over the past year â€” building a profile of your personality, profession, and vulnerabilities) This is the perfect recipe for a psychological profile. Even if a single conversation leaks, the damage is limited. But when your entire thought history is tied to your identity, you become completely transparent to whoever holds that data. **How MindVault Breaks the Chain** With MindVault, you fragment this data monopoly: - **Identity**: Your wallet address, not your email. Pseudonymous by default. - **Current conversation**: Sent to the AI provider, yes â€” but if you use an anonymous API relay, they can't link it to you. - **History**: Encrypted and stored on Walrus. Only you can decrypt it. The AI provider never sees your past. The result? Even if data leaks, it's **fragmented, encrypted, and unlinked**. A broken profile is infinitely better than a complete one. --- ### Story 2: The Timestamp Witness **The Problem with Proving "I Thought of It First"** Screenshots can be faked. Server logs can be tampered with by admins. If you claim "I came up with this idea on January 1st, 2026," it's nearly impossible to prove. **How MindVault Creates Immutable Proof** When you have a critical conversation â€” brainstorming a business plan, getting legal advice, documenting a creative idea â€” MindVault anchors it to the blockchain: 1. **The conversation is encrypted** and stored on Walrus 2. **A transaction is recorded on Sui** containing the hash of the encrypted data and a precise timestamp 3. **The blockchain timestamp cannot be forged** â€” it's consensus-verified by the network Three months later, when there's a copyright dispute or you need to prove prior art: - Export the cryptographic proof from MindVault - Anyone can verify: "This encrypted blob existed at this exact time" - You can optionally reveal the content to prove what was inside **Zero-knowledge verification**: Prove the existence and timing without revealing the content. --- ## What MindVault Does Today MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. ### Core Features **Client-Side Encryption** - All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser - Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt - The key never leaves your device **Decentralized Storage** - Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network - Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain - You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime **Persistent Memory** - Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus - AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) - Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key **Cryptographic Proofs** - Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time - On-chain timestamps cannot be forged - Anyone can verify without seeing the content **Bring Your Own API** - Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) - Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it - If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** --- ## The Privacy Spectrum MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: | Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | |-------|-----------------|-------------------| | MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext | | MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | | MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | **The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. --- ## What We're Building Toward Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: - AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) - Even we cannot see your data - Payment is in crypto, no identity required - The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable **Why can't we do this today?** Technical limitations: - TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental - Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead - The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. --- ## Architecture ``` Use anonymous API â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ for full privacy. â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` --- ## Quick Start ### Prerequisites - Node.js 18+ - Sui Wallet (Sui Wallet, Suiet, etc.) ### 1. Clone & Install ```bash git clone https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui.git cd MindVault-VibeSui/frontend npm install ``` ### 2. Configure ```bash cp .env.example .env.local ``` Edit `.env.local`: ```env NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID=0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6 ``` ### 3. Run ```bash npm run dev ``` Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) ### 4. Use 1. Connect your Sui wallet 2. Go to Settings â†’ Configure your AI provider 3. Start chatting â€” your messages are encrypted and stored on-chain --- ## Deploy Your Own [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) **Important**: Set Root Directory to `frontend` --- ## Smart Contract The `DataVault` contract on Sui gives you **protocol-level ownership**: ```move // Your vault â€” only you can modify it public struct DataVault has key, store { id: UID, blob_count: u64, created_at: u64, // Authorizations stored as dynamic fields } // Store encrypted blob reference public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, ...) // Grant/revoke access â€” you're always in control public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) ``` **Deployed on Testnet**: `0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6` --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Technology | |-------|------------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS | | Blockchain | Sui (Move 2024) | | Storage | Walrus | | Encryption | AES-256-GCM, HKDF | | AI | Any OpenAI-compatible API | --- ## License MIT --- ## Links - [Live Demo](https://mind-vault-vibe-sui.vercel.app) - [GitHub](https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui) - [Sui Docs](https://docs.sui.io/) - [Walrus Docs](https://docs.walrus.site/) --- # MindVault ## content.content: The file /Users/zayn/ALL_Projects/é»‘å®¢æ¾/SuiVibe/README.md has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file: 1â†’# MindVault 2â†’ 3â†’[English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) 4â†’ 5â†’--- 6â†’ 7â†’ 8â†’ 9â†’## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain 10â†’ 11â†’Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: 12â†’ 13â†’- Your thought patterns 14â†’- Your business secrets 15â†’- Your personal struggles 16â†’- Your creative ideas 17â†’- Your private conversations 18â†’ 19â†’All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model. 20â†’ 21â†’**This should terrify any rational person.** 22â†’ 23â†’We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. 24â†’ 25â†’--- 26â†’ 27â†’## The Web3 Alternative 28â†’ 29â†’Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. 30â†’ 31â†’What if your AI conversations were: 32â†’- **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you 33â†’- **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data 34â†’- **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default 35â†’- **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs 36â†’ 37â†’This is what MindVault is building. 38â†’ 39â†’--- 40â†’ 41â†’## User Stories 42â†’ 43â†’### Story 1: The Profile Breaker 44â†’ 45â†’**The Problem with Today's AI Services** 46â†’ 47â†’When you chat with ChatGPT's web interface, OpenAI holds three things: 48â†’ 49â†’1. **Your real identity** (email/phone/credit card) 50â†’2. **Your current intent** (what you're asking right now) 51â†’3. **Your complete history** (everything you've asked over the past year â€” building a profile of your personality, profession, and vulnerabilities) 52â†’ 53â†’This is the perfect recipe for a psychological profile. Even if a single conversation leaks, the damage is limited. But when your entire thought history is tied to your identity, you become completely transparent to whoever holds that data. 54â†’ 55â†’**How MindVault Breaks the Chain** 56â†’ 57â†’With MindVault, you fragment this data monopoly: 58â†’ 59â†’- **Identity**: Your wallet address, not your email. Pseudonymous by default. 60â†’- **Current conversation**: Sent to the AI provider, yes â€” but if you use an anonymous API relay, they can't link it to you. 61â†’- **History**: Encrypted and stored on Walrus. Only you can decrypt it. The AI provider never sees your past. 62â†’ 63â†’The result? Even if data leaks, it's **fragmented, encrypted, and unlinked**. A broken profile is infinitely better than a complete one. 64â†’ 65â†’--- 66â†’ 67â†’### Story 2: The Timestamp Witness 68â†’ 69â†’**The Problem with Proving "I Thought of It First"** 70â†’ 71â†’Screenshots can be faked. Server logs can be tampered with by admins. If you claim "I came up with this idea on January 1st, 2026," it's nearly impossible to prove. 72â†’ 73â†’**How MindVault Creates Immutable Proof** 74â†’ 75â†’When you have a critical conversation â€” brainstorming a business plan, getting legal advice, documenting a creative idea â€” MindVault anchors it to the blockchain: 76â†’ 77â†’1. **The conversation is encrypted** and stored on Walrus 78â†’2. **A transaction is recorded on Sui** containing the hash of the encrypted data and a precise timestamp 79â†’3. **The blockchain timestamp cannot be forged** â€” it's consensus-verified by the network 80â†’ 81â†’Three months later, when there's a copyright dispute or you need to prove prior art: 82â†’ 83â†’- Export the cryptographic proof from MindVault 84â†’- Anyone can verify: "This encrypted blob existed at this exact time" 85â†’- You can optionally reveal the content to prove what was inside 86â†’ 87â†’**Zero-knowledge verification**: Prove the existence and timing without revealing the content. 88â†’ 89â†’--- 90â†’ 91â†’## What MindVault Does Today 92â†’ 93â†’MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. 94â†’ 95â†’### Core Features 96â†’ 97â†’**Client-Side Encryption** 98â†’- All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser 99â†’- Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt 100â†’- The key never leaves your device 101â†’ 102â†’**Decentralized Storage** 103â†’- Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network 104â†’- Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain 105â†’- You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime 106â†’ 107â†’**Persistent Memory** 108â†’- Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus 109â†’- AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) 110â†’- Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key 111â†’ 112â†’**Cryptographic Proofs** 113â†’- Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time 114â†’- On-chain timestamps cannot be forged 115â†’- Anyone can verify without seeing the content 116â†’ 117â†’**Bring Your Own API** 118â†’- Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) 119â†’- Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it 120â†’- If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** 121â†’ 122â†’--- 123â†’ 124â†’## The Privacy Spectrum 125â†’ 126â†’MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: 127â†’ 128â†’| Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | 129â†’|-------|-----------------|-------------------| 130â†’| MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext | 131â†’| MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | 132â†’| MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | 133â†’ 134â†’**The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. 135â†’ 136â†’--- 137â†’ 138â†’## What We're Building Toward 139â†’ 140â†’Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: 141â†’ 142â†’- AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) 143â†’- Even we cannot see your data 144â†’- Payment is in crypto, no identity required 145â†’- The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable 146â†’ 147â†’**Why can't we do this today?** 148â†’ 149â†’Technical limitations: 150â†’- TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental 151â†’- Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead 152â†’- The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature 153â†’ 154â†’But the direction is clear. toolUseResult.content: # MindVault [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: - Your thought patterns - Your business secrets - Your personal struggles - Your creative ideas - Your private conversations All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model. **This should terrify any rational person.** We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. --- ## The Web3 Alternative Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. What if your AI conversations were: - **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you - **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data - **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default - **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs This is what MindVault is building. --- ## User Stories ### Story 1: The Profile Breaker **The Problem with Today's AI Services** When you chat with ChatGPT's web interface, OpenAI holds three things: 1. **Your real identity** (email/phone/credit card) 2. **Your current intent** (what you're asking right now) 3. **Your complete history** (everything you've asked over the past year â€” building a profile of your personality, profession, and vulnerabilities) This is the perfect recipe for a psychological profile. Even if a single conversation leaks, the damage is limited. But when your entire thought history is tied to your identity, you become completely transparent to whoever holds that data. **How MindVault Breaks the Chain** With MindVault, you fragment this data monopoly: - **Identity**: Your wallet address, not your email. Pseudonymous by default. - **Current conversation**: Sent to the AI provider, yes â€” but if you use an anonymous API relay, they can't link it to you. - **History**: Encrypted and stored on Walrus. Only you can decrypt it. The AI provider never sees your past. The result? Even if data leaks, it's **fragmented, encrypted, and unlinked**. A broken profile is infinitely better than a complete one. --- ### Story 2: The Timestamp Witness **The Problem with Proving "I Thought of It First"** Screenshots can be faked. Server logs can be tampered with by admins. If you claim "I came up with this idea on January 1st, 2026," it's nearly impossible to prove. **How MindVault Creates Immutable Proof** When you have a critical conversation â€” brainstorming a business plan, getting legal advice, documenting a creative idea â€” MindVault anchors it to the blockchain: 1. **The conversation is encrypted** and stored on Walrus 2. **A transaction is recorded on Sui** containing the hash of the encrypted data and a precise timestamp 3. **The blockchain timestamp cannot be forged** â€” it's consensus-verified by the network Three months later, when there's a copyright dispute or you need to prove prior art: - Export the cryptographic proof from MindVault - Anyone can verify: "This encrypted blob existed at this exact time" - You can optionally reveal the content to prove what was inside **Zero-knowledge verification**: Prove the existence and timing without revealing the content. --- ## What MindVault Does Today MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. ### Core Features **Client-Side Encryption** - All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser - Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt - The key never leaves your device **Decentralized Storage** - Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network - Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain - You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime **Persistent Memory** - Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus - AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) - Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key **Cryptographic Proofs** - Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time - On-chain timestamps cannot be forged - Anyone can verify without seeing the content **Bring Your Own API** - Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) - Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it - If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** --- ## The Privacy Spectrum MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: | Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | |-------|-----------------|-------------------| | MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext | | MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | | MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | **The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. --- ## What We're Building Toward Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: - AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) - Even we cannot see your data - Payment is in crypto, no identity required - The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable **Why can't we do this today?** Technical limitations: - TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental - Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead - The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. --- ## Architecture ``` Run ```bash npm run dev ``` Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) ### 4. Use 1. Connect your Sui wallet 2. Go to Settings â†’ Configure your AI provider 3. Start chatting â€” your messages are encrypted and stored on-chain --- ## Deploy Your Own [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) **Important**: Set Root Directory to `frontend` --- ## Smart Contract The `DataVault` contract on Sui gives you **protocol-level ownership**: ```move // Your vault â€” only you can modify it public struct DataVault has key, store { id: UID, blob_count: u64, created_at: u64, // Authorizations stored as dynamic fields } // Store encrypted blob reference public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, ...) // Grant/revoke access â€” you're always in control public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) ``` **Deployed on Testnet**: `0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6` --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Technology | |-------|------------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, lines: +When you chat with ChatGPT's web interface, OpenAI holds three things:
+2. **Your current intent** (what you're asking right now)
+3. **Your complete history** (everything you've asked over the past year â€” building a profile of your personality, profession, and vulnerabilities)

+This is the perfect recipe for a psychological profile. Even if a single conversation leaks, the damage is limited. But when your entire thought history is tied to your identity, you become completely transparent to whoever holds that data.
+With MindVault, you fragment this data monopoly:
+- **Identity**: Your wallet address, not your email. Pseudonymous by default.
+- **Current conversation**: Sent to the AI provider, yes â€” but if you use an anonymous API relay, they can't link it to you.
+- **History**: Encrypted and stored on Walrus. Only you can decrypt it. The AI provider never sees your past.
+The result? Even if data leaks, it's **fragmented, encrypted, and unlinked**. A broken profile is infinitely better than a complete one.
+**The Problem with Proving "I Thought of It First"**
+Screenshots can be faked. Server logs can be tampered with by admins. If you claim "I came up with this idea on January 1st, 2026," it's nearly impossible to prove.
+When you have a critical conversation â€” brainstorming a business plan, getting legal advice, documenting a creative idea â€” MindVault anchors it to the blockchain:
+1. **The conversation is encrypted** and stored on Walrus
+2. **A transaction is recorded on Sui** containing the hash of the encrypted data and a precise timestamp
+3. **The blockchain timestamp cannot be forged** â€” it's consensus-verified by the network
+Three months later, when there's a copyright dispute or you need to prove prior art:
+- Export the cryptographic proof from MindVault
+- Anyone can verify: "This encrypted blob existed at this exact time"
+- You can optionally reveal the content to prove what was inside
+**Zero-knowledge verification**: Prove the existence and timing without revealing the content.
MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage.

toolUseResult.originalFile: # MindVault [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: - Your thought patterns - Your business secrets - Your personal struggles - Your creative ideas - Your private conversations All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model. **This should terrify any rational person.** We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. --- ## The Web3 Alternative Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. What if your AI conversations were: - **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you - **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data - **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default - **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs This is what MindVault is building. --- ## What MindVault Does Today MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. ### Core Features **Client-Side Encryption** - All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser - Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt - The key never leaves your device **Decentralized Storage** - Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network - Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain - You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime **Persistent Memory** - Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus - AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) - Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key **Cryptographic Proofs** - Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time - On-chain timestamps cannot be forged - Anyone can verify without seeing the content **Bring Your Own API** - Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) - Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it - If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** --- ## The Privacy Spectrum MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: | Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | |-------|-----------------|-------------------| | MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext | | MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | | MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | **The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. --- ## What We're Building Toward Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: - AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) - Even we cannot see your data - Payment is in crypto, no identity required - The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable **Why can't we do this today?** Technical limitations: - TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental - Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead - The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. --- ## Architecture ``` Use anonymous API â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ for full privacy. â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` --- ## Quick Start ### Prerequisites - Node.js 18+ - Sui Wallet (Sui Wallet, Suiet, etc.) ### 1. Start chatting â€” your messages are encrypted and stored on-chain --- ## Deploy Your Own [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) **Important**: Set Root Directory to `frontend` --- ## Smart Contract The `DataVault` contract on Sui gives you **protocol-level ownership**: ```move // Your vault â€” only you can modify it public struct DataVault has key, store { id: UID, blob_count: u64, created_at: u64, // Authorizations stored as dynamic fields } // Store encrypted blob reference public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, ...) // Grant/revoke access â€” you're always in control public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) ``` **Deployed on Testnet**: `0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6` --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Technology | |-------|------------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS | | Blockchain | Sui (Move 2024) | | Storage | Walrus | | Encryption | AES-256-GCM, HKDF | | AI | Any OpenAI-compatible API | --- ## License MIT --- ## Links - input.content: # MindVault > **Your AI conversations. Your encryption keys. Your rules.** [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## The Problem Every message you send to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service is: - **Tied to your identity** â€” email, phone, payment method - **Stored on their servers** â€” indefinitely, without your control - **Potentially used for training** â€” your thoughts become their product - **Building your psychological profile** â€” one conversation at a time You're not just asking questions. You're handing over your thought patterns, business secrets, personal struggles, and creative ideas â€” all linked to who you are. **MindVault exists because this shouldn't be normal.** --- ## The Solution MindVault is a privacy-first AI chat interface where: | What | How | |------|-----| | **Your messages are encrypted** | AES-256-GCM encryption happens in your browser, before anything leaves | | **You hold the keys** | Encryption key derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt | | **Storage is decentralized** | Encrypted data stored on Walrus, metadata on Sui blockchain | | **History belongs to you** | Load past conversations anytime, from any device, with your wallet | | **Proofs are on-chain** | Tamper-proof timestamps prove when conversations happened | --- ## Who Is This For? ### The Privacy-Conscious Professional **Sarah** is a startup founder who uses AI to brainstorm product strategies, draft investor emails, and analyze competitors. Her conversations contain trade secrets she'd never share publicly. *With traditional AI services:* All her strategic thinking is stored on OpenAI's servers, tied to her company email, potentially used for training, and vulnerable to data breaches. *With MindVault:* Her conversations are encrypted before leaving her browser. Even if Walrus is compromised, attackers get meaningless ciphertext. She can prove when she had an idea (for IP disputes) without revealing what it was. --- ### The Researcher Who Needs Proof **Dr. Chen** is documenting a novel research methodology through AI-assisted brainstorming. Six months later, a competitor publishes something similar. *The problem:* Screenshots can be faked. Server logs can be altered. How do you prove you had the idea first? *With MindVault:* Every conversation is anchored to the Sui blockchain with a precise timestamp. Dr. Chen exports a cryptographic proof showing her encrypted conversation existed on a specific date. She can optionally reveal the content to prove what was inside. The blockchain doesn't lie. --- ### The User Who Wants Control **Alex** simply doesn't want a corporation building a psychological profile from years of AI conversations. He wants to use AI without becoming the product. *With MindVault:* - Identity = wallet address (pseudonymous) - Current conversation = sent to AI, but can use anonymous API relays - History = encrypted, only Alex can read it Even if data leaks, it's **fragmented, encrypted, and unlinked**. A broken profile is infinitely better than a complete one. --- ## Privacy Levels Choose your tradeoff: | Setup | Who sees your data? | |-------|---------------------| | MindVault + OpenAI/Claude API | Storage: Only you / Inference: Provider sees current message | | MindVault + Anonymous API relay | Storage: Only you / Inference: No identity link | | MindVault + Local model (Ollama) | Storage: Only you / Inference: Never leaves your device | **Key insight:** Pair MindVault with an anonymous API (crypto payment, no account) for true end-to-end privacy. --- ## Architecture ``` â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ YOUR BROWSER (Trust Zone) â”‚ â”‚ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ Sui Walletâ”‚ â”‚ AES-256 â”‚ â”‚ Key = HKDF(wallet.sign(...))â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ (identity)â”‚ â”‚ (encrypt) â”‚ â”‚ (only you have this) â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â–¼ â–¼ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ COLD STORAGE (Web3) â”‚ â”‚ HOT PROCESSING (Stateless)â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ Sui: metadata, proofs â”‚ â”‚ API Routes: call LLM, â”‚ â”‚ Walrus: encrypted blobsâ”‚ â”‚ return response, forget â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ ğŸ“Œ You own this. 100%. â”‚ â”‚ ğŸ“Œ We see it briefly, â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ but never store it. â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` --- ## What We're Building Toward MindVault today is step one. The vision: - **TEE-based inference** â€” AI runs in secure enclaves, even we can't see your data - **Crypto payments** â€” No identity required, ever - **Fully trustless pipeline** â€” Verifiable from input to output *Why not today?* TEE + LLM is experimental, performance overhead is significant, infrastructure isn't mature. But the direction is clear. --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Tech | |-------|------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind | | Blockchain | Sui (Move 2024) | | Storage | Walrus | | Encryption | AES-256-GCM, HKDF | | AI | Any OpenAI-compatible API | --- ## Your rules.** 4â†’ 5â†’[English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) 6â†’ 7â†’--- 8â†’ 9â†’ 10â†’ 11â†’## The Problem 12â†’ 13â†’Every message you send to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service is: 14â†’ 15â†’- **Tied to your identity** â€” email, phone, payment method 16â†’- **Stored on their servers** â€” indefinitely, without your control 17â†’- **Potentially used for training** â€” your thoughts become their product 18â†’- **Building your psychological profile** â€” one conversation at a time 19â†’ 20â†’You're not just asking questions. You're handing over your thought patterns, business secrets, personal struggles, and creative ideas â€” all linked to who you are. 21â†’ 22â†’**MindVault exists because this shouldn't be normal.** 23â†’ 24â†’--- 25â†’ 26â†’## The Solution 27â†’ 28â†’MindVault is a privacy-first AI chat interface where: 29â†’ 30â†’| What | How | 31â†’|------|-----| 32â†’| **Your messages are encrypted** | AES-256-GCM encryption happens in your browser, before anything leaves | 33â†’| **You hold the keys** | Encryption key derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt | 34â†’| **Storage is decentralized** | Encrypted data stored on Walrus, metadata on Sui blockchain | 35â†’| **History belongs to you** | Load past conversations anytime, from any device, with your wallet | 36â†’| **Proofs are on-chain** | Tamper-proof timestamps prove when conversations happened | 37â†’ 38â†’--- 39â†’ 40â†’## Who Is This For? 41â†’ 42â†’### The Privacy-Conscious Professional 43â†’ 44â†’**Sarah** is a startup founder who uses AI to brainstorm product strategies, draft investor emails, and analyze competitors. Her conversations contain trade secrets she'd never share publicly. 45â†’ 46â†’*With traditional AI services:* All her strategic thinking is stored on OpenAI's servers, tied to her company email, potentially used for training, and vulnerable to data breaches. 47â†’ 48â†’*With MindVault:* Her conversations are encrypted before leaving her browser. Even if Walrus is compromised, attackers get meaningless ciphertext. She can prove when she had an idea (for IP disputes) without revealing what it was. 49â†’ 50â†’--- 51â†’ 52â†’### The Researcher Who Needs Proof 53â†’ 54â†’**Dr. Chen** is documenting a novel research methodology through AI-assisted brainstorming. Six months later, a competitor publishes something similar. 55â†’ 56â†’*The problem:* Screenshots can be faked. Server logs can be altered. How do you prove you had the idea first? 57â†’ 58â†’*With MindVault:* Every conversation is anchored to the Sui blockchain with a precise timestamp. Dr. Chen exports a cryptographic proof showing her encrypted conversation existed on a specific date. She can optionally reveal the content to prove what was inside. The blockchain doesn't lie. 59â†’ 60â†’--- 61â†’ 62â†’### The User Who Wants Control 63â†’ 64â†’**Alex** simply doesn't want a corporation building a psychological profile from years of AI conversations. He wants to use AI without becoming the product. 65â†’ 66â†’*With MindVault:* 67â†’- Identity = wallet address (pseudonymous) 68â†’- Current conversation = sent to AI, but can use anonymous API relays 69â†’- History = encrypted, only Alex can read it 70â†’ 71â†’Even if data leaks, it's **fragmented, encrypted, and unlinked**. A broken profile is infinitely better than a complete one. 72â†’ 73â†’--- 74â†’ 75â†’## Privacy Levels 76â†’ 77â†’Choose your tradeoff: 78â†’ 79â†’| Setup | Who sees your data? | 80â†’|-------|---------------------| 81â†’| MindVault + OpenAI/Claude API | Storage: Only you / Inference: Provider sees current message | 82â†’| MindVault + Anonymous API relay | Storage: Only you / Inference: No identity link | 83â†’| MindVault + Local model (Ollama) | Storage: Only you / Inference: Never leaves your device | 84â†’ 85â†’**Key insight:** Pair MindVault with an anonymous API (crypto payment, no account) for true end-to-end privacy. 86â†’ 87â†’--- 88â†’ 89â†’## Architecture 90â†’ 91â†’``` toolUseResult.content: # MindVault > **Your AI conversations. Your encryption keys. Your rules.** [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## The Problem Every message you send to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service is: - **Tied to your identity** â€” email, phone, payment method - **Stored on their servers** â€” indefinitely, without your control - **Potentially used for training** â€” your thoughts become their product - **Building your psychological profile** â€” one conversation at a time You're not just asking questions. You're handing over your thought patterns, business secrets, personal struggles, and creative ideas â€” all linked to who you are. **MindVault exists because this shouldn't be normal.** --- ## The Solution MindVault is a privacy-first AI chat interface where: | What | How | |------|-----| | **Your messages are encrypted** | AES-256-GCM encryption happens in your browser, before anything leaves | | **You hold the keys** | Encryption key derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt | | **Storage is decentralized** | Encrypted data stored on Walrus, metadata on Sui blockchain | | **History belongs to you** | Load past conversations anytime, from any device, with your wallet | | **Proofs are on-chain** | Tamper-proof timestamps prove when conversations happened | --- ## Who Is This For? ### The Privacy-Conscious Professional **Sarah** is a startup founder who uses AI to brainstorm product strategies, draft investor emails, and analyze competitors. Her conversations contain trade secrets she'd never share publicly. *With traditional AI services:* All her strategic thinking is stored on OpenAI's servers, tied to her company email, potentially used for training, and vulnerable to data breaches. *With MindVault:* Her conversations are encrypted before leaving her browser. Even if Walrus is compromised, attackers get meaningless ciphertext. She can prove when she had an idea (for IP disputes) without revealing what it was. --- ### The Researcher Who Needs Proof **Dr. Chen** is documenting a novel research methodology through AI-assisted brainstorming. Six months later, a competitor publishes something similar. *The problem:* Screenshots can be faked. Server logs can be altered. How do you prove you had the idea first? *With MindVault:* Every conversation is anchored to the Sui blockchain with a precise timestamp. Dr. Chen exports a cryptographic proof showing her encrypted conversation existed on a specific date. She can optionally reveal the content to prove what was inside. The blockchain doesn't lie. --- ### The User Who Wants Control **Alex** simply doesn't want a corporation building a psychological profile from years of AI conversations. He wants to use AI without becoming the product. *With MindVault:* - Identity = wallet address (pseudonymous) - Current conversation = sent to AI, but can use anonymous API relays - History = encrypted, only Alex can read it Even if data leaks, it's **fragmented, encrypted, and unlinked**. A broken profile is infinitely better than a complete one. --- ## Privacy Levels Choose your tradeoff: | Setup | Who sees your data? | |-------|---------------------| | MindVault + OpenAI/Claude API | Storage: Only you / Inference: Provider sees current message | | MindVault + Anonymous API relay | Storage: Only you / Inference: No identity link | | MindVault + Local model (Ollama) | Storage: Only you / Inference: Never leaves your device | **Key insight:** Pair MindVault with an anonymous API (crypto payment, no account) for true end-to-end privacy. --- ## Architecture ``` â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ YOUR BROWSER (Trust Zone) â”‚ â”‚ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ Sui Walletâ”‚ â”‚ AES-256 â”‚ â”‚ Key = HKDF(wallet.sign(...))â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ (identity)â”‚ â”‚ (encrypt) â”‚ â”‚ (only you have this) â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â–¼ â–¼ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ COLD STORAGE (Web3) â”‚ â”‚ HOT PROCESSING (Stateless)â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ Sui: metadata, proofs â”‚ â”‚ API Routes: call LLM, â”‚ â”‚ Walrus: encrypted blobsâ”‚ â”‚ return response, forget â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ ğŸ“Œ You own this. 100%. â”‚ â”‚ ğŸ“Œ We see it briefly, â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ but never store it. â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` --- ## What We're Building Toward MindVault today is step one. The vision: - **TEE-based inference** â€” AI runs in secure enclaves, even we can't see your data - **Crypto payments** â€” No identity required, ever - **Fully trustless pipeline** â€” Verifiable from input to output *Why not today?* TEE + LLM is experimental, performance overhead is significant, infrastructure isn't mature. But the direction is clear. --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Tech | |-------|------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind | | Blockchain | Sui (Move 2024) | | Storage | Walrus | | Encryption | AES-256-GCM, HKDF | | AI | Any OpenAI-compatible API | --- ## lines: +> **Your AI conversations. Your encryption keys. Your rules.**
-## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain
-Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over:
+Every message you send to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service is:
+- **Tied to your identity** â€” email, phone, payment method
+- **Stored on their servers** â€” indefinitely, without your control
+- **Potentially used for training** â€” your thoughts become their product
+- **Building your psychological profile** â€” one conversation at a time

-All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model.
+You're not just asking questions. You're handing over your thought patterns, business secrets, personal struggles, and creative ideas â€” all linked to who you are.
+**MindVault exists because this shouldn't be normal.**
-We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time.
-Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**.
+MindVault is a privacy-first AI chat interface where:
-- **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you
-- **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data
-- **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default
-- **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs
+| **Your messages are encrypted** | AES-256-GCM encryption happens in your browser, before anything leaves |
+| **You hold the keys** | Encryption key derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt |
+| **Storage is decentralized** | Encrypted data stored on Walrus, metadata on Sui blockchain |
+| **History belongs to you** | Load past conversations anytime, from any device, with your wallet |
+| **Proofs are on-chain** | Tamper-proof timestamps prove when conversations happened |
+**Sarah** is a startup founder who uses AI to brainstorm product strategies, draft investor emails, and analyze competitors. Her conversations contain trade secrets she'd never share publicly.
-When you chat with ChatGPT's web interface, OpenAI holds three things:
+*With traditional AI services:* All her strategic thinking is stored on OpenAI's servers, tied to her company email, potentially used for training, and vulnerable to data breaches.
-2. **Your current intent** (what you're asking right now)
-3. **Your complete history** (everything you've asked over the past year â€” building a profile of your personality, profession, and vulnerabilities)

+*With MindVault:* Her conversations are encrypted before leaving her browser. Even if Walrus is compromised, attackers get meaningless ciphertext. She can prove when she had an idea (for IP disputes) without revealing what it was.

-This is the perfect recipe for a psychological profile. Even if a single conversation leaks, the damage is limited. But when your entire thought history is tied to your identity, you become completely transparent to whoever holds that data.
-With MindVault, you fragment this data monopoly:
-- **Identity**: Your wallet address, not your email. Pseudonymous by default.
-- **Current conversation**: Sent to the AI provider, yes â€” but if you use an anonymous API relay, they can't link it to you.
-- **History**: Encrypted and stored on Walrus. Only you can decrypt it. The AI provider never sees your past.
-The result? Even if data leaks, it's **fragmented, encrypted, and unlinked**. A broken profile is infinitely better than a complete one.
-**The Problem with Proving "I Thought of It First"**
+**Dr. Chen** is documenting a novel research methodology through AI-assisted brainstorming. Six months later, a competitor publishes something similar.
-Screenshots can be faked. Server logs can be tampered with by admins. If you claim "I came up with this idea on January 1st, 2026," it's nearly impossible to prove.
+*The problem:* Screenshots can be faked. Server logs can be altered. How do you prove you had the idea first?

+*With MindVault:* Every conversation is anchored to the Sui blockchain with a precise timestamp. Dr. Chen exports a cryptographic proof showing her encrypted conversation existed on a specific date. She can optionally reveal the content to prove what was inside. The blockchain doesn't lie.
-When you have a critical conversation â€” brainstorming a business plan, getting legal advice, documenting a creative idea â€” MindVault anchors it to the blockchain:
-1. **The conversation is encrypted** and stored on Walrus
-2. **A transaction is recorded on Sui** containing the hash of the encrypted data and a precise timestamp
-3. **The blockchain timestamp cannot be forged** â€” it's consensus-verified by the network
-Three months later, when there's a copyright dispute or you need to prove prior art:
-- Export the cryptographic proof from MindVault
-- Anyone can verify: "This encrypted blob existed at this exact time"
-- You can optionally reveal the content to prove what was inside
-**Zero-knowledge verification**: Prove the existence and timing without revealing the content.
-MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage.
+**Alex** simply doesn't want a corporation building a psychological profile from years of AI conversations. He wants to use AI without becoming the product.
+- Current conversation = sent to AI, but can use anonymous API relays
+- History = encrypted, only Alex can read it
-- All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser
-- Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt
-- The key never leaves your device
+Even if data leaks, it's **fragmented, encrypted, and unlinked**. A broken profile is infinitely better than a complete one.
-- Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network
-- Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain
-- You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime
-- Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus
-- AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission)
-- Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key
-- Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time
-- Anyone can verify without seeing the content
-- Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.)
-- Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it
-- If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous**
-MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup:
-| MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext |
-| MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding |
-| MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device |
+| MindVault + OpenAI/Claude API | Storage: Only you / Inference: Provider sees current message |
+| MindVault + Anonymous API relay | Storage: Only you / Inference: No identity link |
+| MindVault + Local model (Ollama) | Storage: Only you / Inference: Never leaves your device |
-**The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**.
+**Key insight:** Pair MindVault with an anonymous API (crypto payment, no account) for true end-to-end privacy.
-Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where:
-- AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE)
-- Even we cannot see your data
-- Payment is in crypto, no identity required
-- The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable
-- TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental
-- Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead
-- The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature
-But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step.

-2. Go to Settings â†’ Configure your AI provider
-3. Start chatting â€” your messages are encrypted and stored on-chain
-The `DataVault` contract on Sui gives you **protocol-level ownership**:
+MindVault today is step one. The vision:

toolUseResult.originalFile: # MindVault [English](#english) | [ä¸­æ–‡](#ä¸­æ–‡) --- ## Manifesto: AI API Services Should Be On-Chain Every time you send a message to ChatGPT, Claude, or any AI service, you're handing over more than just a question. You're handing over: - Your thought patterns - Your business secrets - Your personal struggles - Your creative ideas - Your private conversations All of this is **bound to your identity** â€” your email, your phone number, your payment method. The AI companies know who you are, what you think, and how you think. They store it. They analyze it. They may use it to train the next model. **This should terrify any rational person.** We are building the most detailed psychological profiles in human history, and we're doing it voluntarily, one API call at a time. --- ## The Web3 Alternative Blockchain gives us something the traditional web never could: **cryptographic ownership**. What if your AI conversations were: - **Encrypted before they leave your browser** â€” no one sees the plaintext except you - **Stored on decentralized infrastructure** â€” no single company controls your data - **Tied to your wallet, not your identity** â€” pseudonymous by default - **Verifiable on-chain** â€” tamper-proof timestamps, cryptographic proofs This is what MindVault is building. --- ## User Stories ### Story 1: The Profile Breaker **The Problem with Today's AI Services** When you chat with ChatGPT's web interface, OpenAI holds three things: 1. **Your real identity** (email/phone/credit card) 2. **Your current intent** (what you're asking right now) 3. **Your complete history** (everything you've asked over the past year â€” building a profile of your personality, profession, and vulnerabilities) This is the perfect recipe for a psychological profile. Even if a single conversation leaks, the damage is limited. But when your entire thought history is tied to your identity, you become completely transparent to whoever holds that data. **How MindVault Breaks the Chain** With MindVault, you fragment this data monopoly: - **Identity**: Your wallet address, not your email. Pseudonymous by default. - **Current conversation**: Sent to the AI provider, yes â€” but if you use an anonymous API relay, they can't link it to you. - **History**: Encrypted and stored on Walrus. Only you can decrypt it. The AI provider never sees your past. The result? Even if data leaks, it's **fragmented, encrypted, and unlinked**. A broken profile is infinitely better than a complete one. --- ### Story 2: The Timestamp Witness **The Problem with Proving "I Thought of It First"** Screenshots can be faked. Server logs can be tampered with by admins. If you claim "I came up with this idea on January 1st, 2026," it's nearly impossible to prove. **How MindVault Creates Immutable Proof** When you have a critical conversation â€” brainstorming a business plan, getting legal advice, documenting a creative idea â€” MindVault anchors it to the blockchain: 1. **The conversation is encrypted** and stored on Walrus 2. **A transaction is recorded on Sui** containing the hash of the encrypted data and a precise timestamp 3. **The blockchain timestamp cannot be forged** â€” it's consensus-verified by the network Three months later, when there's a copyright dispute or you need to prove prior art: - Export the cryptographic proof from MindVault - Anyone can verify: "This encrypted blob existed at this exact time" - You can optionally reveal the content to prove what was inside **Zero-knowledge verification**: Prove the existence and timing without revealing the content. --- ## What MindVault Does Today MindVault is a **privacy-first AI chat interface** built on Sui blockchain and Walrus storage. ### Core Features **Client-Side Encryption** - All messages are encrypted with AES-256-GCM in your browser - Encryption key is derived from your wallet signature â€” only you can decrypt - The key never leaves your device **Decentralized Storage** - Encrypted conversations are stored on Walrus, a decentralized storage network - Metadata and access control are managed on Sui blockchain - You own your data â€” export, delete, or migrate anytime **Persistent Memory** - Load your encrypted chat history from Walrus - AI remembers your previous conversations (with your permission) - Cross-device access â€” your wallet is your key **Cryptographic Proofs** - Generate verifiable proofs that a conversation happened at a specific time - On-chain timestamps cannot be forged - Anyone can verify without seeing the content **Bring Your Own API** - Use any OpenAI-compatible API (OpenAI, Claude, DeepSeek, Ollama, etc.) - Your API key stays in your browser â€” we never see it - If you use an API that doesn't require identity verification, **your conversations become truly anonymous** --- ## The Privacy Spectrum MindVault offers different levels of privacy depending on your setup: | Setup | Storage Privacy | Inference Privacy | |-------|-----------------|-------------------| | MindVault + OpenAI API | âœ… Encrypted | âš ï¸ OpenAI sees plaintext | | MindVault + Anonymous API | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… No identity binding | | MindVault + Local Model (Ollama) | âœ… Encrypted | âœ… Never leaves your device | **The key insight**: If you use an API that doesn't verify your identity (pay with crypto, no account required), combined with MindVault's encrypted storage, you achieve **true end-to-end privacy**. --- ## What We're Building Toward Our vision is a **fully on-chain AI API provider** where: - AI inference happens in Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) - Even we cannot see your data - Payment is in crypto, no identity required - The entire pipeline is trustless and verifiable **Why can't we do this today?** Technical limitations: - TEE-based LLM inference is still experimental - Running large models in secure enclaves has significant performance overhead - The infrastructure for decentralized AI compute is not mature But the direction is clear. MindVault is the first step. --- ## Architecture ``` â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ DataVault (your object) â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ Receive decrypted message â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ Blob references â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€ Call LLM API â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€ Access permissions â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€ Return response (no storage) â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ Walrus Storage â”‚ â”‚ âš ï¸ Stateless: memory released after â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€ AES-256 encrypted blobs â”‚ â”‚ each request, nothing persisted â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ ğŸ“Œ You own this. 100%. â”‚ â”‚ ğŸ“Œ We see plaintext briefly, but we â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ don't store it. Use anonymous API â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ for full privacy. â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` --- ## Quick Start ### Prerequisites - Node.js 18+ - Sui Wallet (Sui Wallet, Suiet, etc.) ### 1. Clone & Install ```bash git clone https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui.git cd MindVault-VibeSui/frontend npm install ``` ### 2. Configure ```bash cp .env.example .env.local ``` Edit `.env.local`: ```env NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID=0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6 ``` ### 3. Run ```bash npm run dev ``` Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) ### 4. Use 1. Connect your Sui wallet 2. Go to Settings â†’ Configure your AI provider 3. Start chatting â€” your messages are encrypted and stored on-chain --- ## Deploy Your Own [![Deploy with Vercel](https://vercel.com/button)](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui&root-directory=frontend&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_PACKAGE_ID) **Important**: Set Root Directory to `frontend` --- ## Smart Contract The `DataVault` contract on Sui gives you **protocol-level ownership**: ```move // Your vault â€” only you can modify it public struct DataVault has key, store { id: UID, blob_count: u64, created_at: u64, // Authorizations stored as dynamic fields } // Store encrypted blob reference public entry fun store_blob(vault: &mut DataVault, blob_id: vector, ...) // Grant/revoke access â€” you're always in control public entry fun grant_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) public entry fun revoke_access(vault: &mut DataVault, provider: address, ...) ``` **Deployed on Testnet**: `0xd8e2b3eeeeacbf0f42c0be6c86cc4a95b0a86b884c63678d13fc055afc3d82a6` --- ## Tech Stack | Layer | Technology | |-------|------------| | Frontend | Next.js 15, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS | | Blockchain | Sui (Move 2024) | | Storage | Walrus | | Encryption | AES-256-GCM, HKDF | | AI | Any OpenAI-compatible API | --- ## License MIT --- ## Links - [Live Demo](https://mind-vault-vibe-sui.vercel.app) - [GitHub](https://github.com/Azurboy/MindVault-VibeSui) - [Sui Docs](https://docs.sui.io/) - [Walrus Docs](https://docs.walrus.site/) --- # MindVault ## message.content:
This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The summary below covers the earlier portion of the conversation.

Analysis:
Let me analyze the conversation chronologically:

1. **Initial Plan**: The user provided a detailed implementation plan for MindVault - a privacy AI API gateway built on Sui blockchain with Walrus storage. The plan included:
   - Move smart contracts for DataVault
   - Frontend with Next.js
   - Client-side encryption (AES-256-GCM)
   - Walrus storage integration
   - Custom AI provider support

2. **First Implementation Phase**: I explored the codebase and found it already had a solid foundation. I then implemented:
   - `getAllBlobRefs()` and `getBlobRef()` functions in sui.ts for querying blob references
   - `loadHistory()` method in useVault.ts for loading encrypted chat history
   - Created `/verify` page for proof verification
   - Created `proof.ts` library for generating/verifying conversation proofs
   - Updated ChatInterface with history loading and proof export
   - Updated Header with Verify link
   - Updated README with new features

3. **Git Push and Wallet Persistence Fix**: Pushed changes to GitHub. User reported wallet connection persistence issues - having to reconnect wallet repeatedly. I fixed this by:
   - Adding explicit `storage` config to WalletProvider
   - Caching encryption signature in sessionStorage
   - Auto-restoring encryption key from cache

4. **README Rewrite**: User requested a complete README rewrite with:
   - A manifesto-style opening about AI API services being on-chain
   - User stories/scenarios
   - Honest disclosure about what MindVault can/cannot do
   - Privacy spectrum table

5. **Multiple README Iterations**: The user made several modifications to the README, and I helped sync English/Chinese versions and add user stories. The final README structure includes:
   - Problem statement comparing Web Apps vs API Clients vs MindVault
   - What MindVault Actually Does (honest disclosure)
   - User personas (Sarah, Alex, Dr. Chen)
   - Privacy Architecture
   - Roadmap (Phase 1-3)

6. **Most Recent Request - Manual Sync Feature**: The user requested changing the chat logic from auto-sync to manual sync:
   - Chat should run locally without Sui interaction
   - Add a prominent "Sync to Vault" button
   - User clicks once to batch-upload all messages to chain

7. **ChatInterface Rewrite**: I completely rewrote ChatInterface.tsx to implement manual sync:
   - Messages stored in localStorage, not auto-synced
   - Added `synced` flag to track which messages are on-chain
   - Added "Sync to Vault" button with gradient styling
   - Shows sync progress during upload
   - Messages show "Local" or "On-chain" status
   - Added Clear button with confirmation for unsynced messages

The user then said "ç»§ç»­" (continue) multiple times, and the system showed various file modifications. The user's last message repeated the manual sync request, asking me to continue the changes.

Summary:
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   The user is building MindVault, a privacy-first AI chat interface on Sui blockchain with Walrus storage. The most recent explicit request is to change the chat logic from automatic sync to **manual sync**:
   - Chat should run locally (localStorage/memory) without Sui interaction
   - Add a prominent "Sync to Vault" button
   - When clicked, batch-upload all unsynced messages to chain in one operation
   - This reduces wallet interaction friction (no popup for every message)

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - Sui blockchain with Move 2024 smart contracts
   - Walrus decentralized storage
   - AES-256-GCM client-side encryption with HKDF key derivation from wallet signature
   - @mysten/dapp-kit for wallet integration
   - Next.js 15 with TypeScript and Tailwind CSS
   - Cryptographic proofs for conversation timestamps
   - Manual sync pattern (local-first, sync on demand)

3. Files and Code Sections:
   - **frontend/src/components/ChatInterface.tsx** (MOST IMPORTANT - just rewritten)
     - Changed from auto-sync to manual sync pattern
     - Added `synced` boolean flag to Message interface
     - Added localStorage persistence for messages
     - Added "Sync to Vault" button with gradient styling
     - Shows sync progress during batch upload
     - Messages display "Local" (yellow) or "On-chain" (green) status
     ```typescript
     const LOCAL_MESSAGES_KEY = "mindvault_local_messages";
     
     // Sync to Vault Button
     {account && unsyncedCount > 0 && (
       <button
         onClick={handleSyncToVault}
         disabled={isSyncing}
         className="flex items-center gap-2 px-4 py-2 rounded-lg text-sm font-medium bg-gradient-to-r from-blue-600 to-purple-600..."
       >
         <Upload className="w-4 h-4" />
         Sync to Vault ({unsyncedCount})
       </button>
     )}
     ```

   - **frontend/src/lib/sui.ts** - Added `getAllBlobRefs()` and `getBlobRef()` for querying blob references from chain
   
   - **frontend/src/lib/proof.ts** - Created for generating/verifying conversation proofs
   
   - **frontend/src/hooks/useVault.ts** - Added `loadHistory()` method and `StoredMessage` interface
   
   - **frontend/src/lib/encryption.ts** - Added signature caching in sessionStorage for persistence
   
   - **frontend/src/components/Providers.tsx** - Added explicit storage config for wallet persistence
   
   - **README.md** - Completely rewritten with manifesto, user stories, privacy architecture, roadmap

4. Errors and fixes:
   - **TypeScript error in verify/page.tsx**: `NETWORK === "mainnet"` comparison failed because NETWORK is typed as literal `"testnet"`. Fixed by casting: `const network = NETWORK as string;`
   - **Wallet persistence issue**: User complained about repeated wallet connection requests. Fixed by adding explicit `storage={getStorage()}` to WalletProvider and caching encryption signatures in sessionStorage.

5. Problem Solving:
   - Solved wallet connection persistence by caching in localStorage
   - Solved encryption key persistence by caching signature in sessionStorage
   - Implemented manual sync pattern to reduce wallet popup friction
   - Created proof verification system for on-chain timestamps

6. All user messages:
   - Initial implementation plan for MindVault
   - "æ¨é€åˆ°githubä»“åº“å¹¶æ£€æµ‹verceléƒ¨ç½²ã€‚ä¸Šä¸€ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸­æˆ‘å‘ç°ç½‘ç«™ä¼¼ä¹ä¸ä¼šå­˜å‚¨é’±åŒ…çš„ç™»å½•ä¿¡æ¯ï¼Œå¾€å¾€æ€»æ˜¯ä¸€ç›´åœ¨é‡å¤è¦æ±‚é“¾æ¥é’±åŒ…è¾“å…¥å¯†ç ç­‰æ“ä½œï¼Œæœ‰ç‚¹éº»çƒ¦ï¼Œé‡ç‚¹å…³æ³¨è¿™å—å„¿"
   - "é‡æ–°å†™readmeã€‚æ–°åŠŸèƒ½ä¸åº”è¯¥å†™æˆæ–°åŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œè€Œæ˜¯åº”è¯¥èå…¥æ•´ä¸ªå™äº‹ä¸­..." (detailed README rewrite request with manifesto style)
   - "æˆ‘æ”¹äº†ç‚¹readmeçš„ä¸­æ–‡ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼Œä½ çœ‹ä¸€ä¸‹ç„¶åæ”¹ä¸€ä¸‹å¯¹åº”çš„è‹±æ–‡ã€‚ä»¥åŠæˆ‘æƒ³åŠ å…¥ä¸€äº›å…·ä½“ç”¨æˆ·åœºæ™¯æˆ–è€…æ•…äº‹..."
   - "å¥½åƒå› ä¸ºæˆ‘æ‰“å¼€äº†æ–‡ä»¶æ²¡ä¿å­˜ä¸Šï¼Œä½ çœ‹çœ‹å‘¢ï¼Ÿä¿å­˜ä¸Šæ²¡"
   - "æˆ‘ä¸å°å¿ƒåˆ é™¤äº†è€Œå·²ï¼Œä½ å¸®æˆ‘åŠ å›å»"
   - "okä½ å†æƒ³æƒ³ç”¨æˆ·ä½¿ç”¨åœºæ™¯è¿™å—å„¿ä»¥åŠæ•´ä½“readmeçš„å¯è¯»æ€§...æ”¹å¥½äº†å¯ä»¥æ¨é€"
   - "å¸®æˆ‘ä¿®æ”¹ä¸€ä¸‹é¡¹ç›®ã€‚ç°åœ¨é¡¹ç›®æ¯ä¸€æ¬¡å’ŒAIå¯¹è¯æ—¶éƒ½è¦é“¾æ¥é’±åŒ…ï¼Œéå¸¸åœ°éº»çƒ¦ã€‚æˆ‘æƒ³æ”¹ä¸€ä¸‹é€»è¾‘...æˆ‘æƒ³æ”¹ä¸º'æ‰‹åŠ¨å­˜æ¡£'..." (manual sync request)
   - "ï¼Ÿç»§ç»­" (multiple times)
   - "å¸®æˆ‘ä¿®æ”¹ä¸€ä¸‹é¡¹ç›®..." (repeated manual sync request)

7. Pending Tasks:
   - Build and test the ChatInterface changes
   - Push the manual sync changes to GitHub
   - Verify Vercel deployment

8. Current Work:
   I had just completed rewriting ChatInterface.tsx to implement the manual sync feature. The file was successfully written with:
   - Local-first message storage in localStorage
   - "Sync to Vault" button that batch-uploads unsynced messages
   - Visual indicators for synced vs local messages
   - Sync progress display
   
   The user said "ç»§ç»­" (continue) and then repeated the manual sync request, indicating they want me to continue with the implementation.

9. Optional Next Step:
   Build the project to verify the ChatInterface changes compile correctly, then push to GitHub:
   ```bash
   cd /Users/zayn/ALL_Projects/é»‘å®¢æ¾/SuiVibe/frontend && npm run build
   ```

input.command:
git add frontend/src/components/ChatInterface.tsx && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
feat: Change to manual sync pattern for chat messages

- Messages now stored locally in localStorage, not auto-synced
- Added prominent "Sync to Vault" button with gradient styling
- Batch upload all unsynced messages when user clicks sync
- Shows sync progress during upload (x/n messages)
- Messages display "Local" (yellow) or "On-chain" (green) status
- Added "Load History" button to fetch from Walrus
- Added "Clear" button with confirmation for unsynced messages
- Reduces wallet popup friction - only one signature per sync

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"
